I was ready to throw away my belongings before I would allow United to scam me out $55. Fortunately, the attendant eventually let me board with my small backpack. I had already spent $17 to UPS some of my belongings home, so my luggage contained even less than when I had flown TO my destination. That was also Basic Economy on United -- and neither the counter attendant nor the gate attendant had had any issue with my backpack for that flight. I will never again fly United. Other airlines have Basic Economy -- but those rules are much less restrictive and those carriers do not treat their passengers nearly as poorly. United treats you like chattel. Also: my ticket was not even inexpensive!!! I had already paid more than I usually do for a ticket to Fort Lauderdale, which was why I had decided not to upgrade from Basic Economy or pay extra for luggage. Expensive ticket, very little luggage allowance, no choice of seat, and terrible treatment by the airline employees in the airport.
ReviewTitle: "scam you out of $55 at the gate"

FullReview: |  Memphis to Vancouver via Chicago. This is just one incident of many that have made me believe this is the worst airlin. Delays, long lines, rude hostesses, and 45min+ wait ties on calls and pulling teeth for legit refunds. Not to mention their non-existent inflight entertainment app is a joke that never works and when it does, feels like it was developed by a 12 year old in a basement, it's that horrible. These guys have made me miss holidays, family events, and so much more. I am sworn to never fly United again. I don't care if I have 3 connections and it takes 3x as long, I will never put myself through the pain and suffering of flying this miserable excuse of an airline.

|  Cancun to San Francisco. The absolute worst airline I have ever flown. I booked these flights months ago and have literally had nothing but problems since. To start out after well over twelve hours between on the phone and Facebook messenger (because god forbid they actually respond on the post they send you a private message to try and resolve. After all this time they said they had everything fixed then when we go to finally start our vacation they changed seats on my wife and I and we were no longer together (oh yeah and they were no help again) next flight was fine from Houston the Cancún. Leaving Cancún to San Francisco they told us to just keep our Duty Free with us that they didn’t need it. Upon arriving to San Francisco we are told we have to collect our bags and recheck them - and we have to be able to fit 4 bottles of alcohol in 1 checked bag that was already over stuffed. (United also charges for every checked back so no I know why, they get to make another 50.00 for an additional checked bag), after being sent to several different representatives by United personnel we ended up 30 minutes later back to the same one who gladly checked another bag (at that wonderful charge) My United Mileage Plus card will be cancelled tomorrow. United Airlines is absolutely horrible, they will take more and more and give the consumer less each time. Oh by the way Cancún to San Francisco left at almost 6:00 p.m. and was 6 hours they didn’t even offer a snack. Avoid them at all cost look around there are much better airlines.

|  Dulles to Plattsburgh. There were issues with the plane to Plattsburgh NY when arriving on flight from Orlando. We had to wait 5 hours for mechanics to arrive from Detroit. I would think being located in the nation's capital you would have mechanics on site. I'll pass on flying United in the future.

|  Sydney to Houston. I was told that I could use either the Singapore or Air New Zealand Lounge. I chose the Singapore Lounge and enjoyed the bacon and eggs and Champagne at 9:45 am. The Business cabin seating is 2-2-2, which makes sleeping on one's side and back comfortable but very tight when sleeping on my front. There was an excellent selection of movies to chose from. The salad was very small and no food was served for a good eleven hours--just lunch after takeoff and breakfast before landing. I would suggest more options in the galley. The fasten seatbelt sign came on many times during the flight with the recorded announcement, "please fasten your seatbelt." I was really happy that they did not make announcements in a second or third language which can make sleeping with United very difficult. The flight attendants did a good job and had a sense of humor but it was an older crew. The flight arrived 20 minutes late so I only had 40 minutes go through Immigration and Customs, claim my suitcase, go through security and transfer from Terminal E to Terminal C for my next flight to Orlando, but I boarded with Group 5 and made the flight.

|  Las Vegas to Rochester via Washington DC. I have never seen some thing like this in my life. They have changed the flight schedule 6 times so far (I’m still at the airport and still there is a possibility for another change). At the beginning departure from DC was at 8:25 am then changed respectively to 10:00 am, 12:20, 12:40, again 12:20, 12:45 and finally 1:30pm and God knows if they are gonna change it again or not because right now the time is 1:35pm and they have not announced any thing for boarding yet. I think United is the worst airline I have ever seen. This is my last flight with United ever(if it happens at all)
Route: Las Vegas to Rochester via Washington DC

FullReview: |  Chicago to Kansas city. Given a chance would rate 0 for this airline. I had many bad experiences with this airlines but today was the worst till date. I had an email/text saying that they might experience delays and I called customer service for alternate options and nothing seemed to workout and so I decided to cancel the flight and go ahead with some other options available and they said they won’t refund until they cancel the flight and they gave me the worst options and made me stay at the airport for almost 12 hours transferring here and there almost 5 times delaying all my plans planned ahead

|  My flight was scheduled to leave at 6:30am from Cleveland. We sat on the airplane for 2 1/2 hours with incorrect and misleading updates coming every 30 minutes. We were told that the airplane needed an oil change and that we would only be delayed 30 minutes. After missing my connecting flight I went to customer service and was told if I hurry I can make it to the flight that was still boarding to make it to my destination. Was turned away at the gate saying they didn’t make accommodations for everyone on my previous flight. When I expressed that I was directed to that gate from customer service I was told that the previous person was mistaken and I was going to have to wait until 2:45. Putting me at my final destination 5 hours behind schedule. Making me miss my ride and events planned ahead of time. Board and crew were nice on the first flight but all of the misscommunication between what was going on while we sat on the tarmac and once getting to the Houston airport was awful.
Route: Cleveland to New Orleans via Houston

FullReview: |  Oklahoma City to Washington. Today I had the seemingly bad luck of flying with United.  After getting to the airport I found out my flight was cancelled. Once I found out I went to the nearest United ticket counter but on the way ran into a gate agent who said "you should have known the flight was cancelled since 1pm." I responded sorry I was at work I didn't know.  She tells me her plane is arriving which wasn't at the gate refused to help and does a slight jog to the gate and tells me to go back through security to the ticket desk.  Once I get to ticketing outside of security the agent simply keeps repeating that "flight is cancelled due to weather".  She reluctantly says after me asking repeatedly what does that mean, that I have to get myself a hotel for the night. She doesn't offer me any kind of information on how or who to call. She just ask if i was from there and I said no. After I ask another agent what does this mean she hands me a pink form with number and how to get a hotel. I then go back through security and once I look at the board I see a flight that will get me out of OKC with these very unhelpful United Employees. I call customer service and they rebook me on the IAH flight so I can get out of OKC and guess whose gate it is... The gate agent who says she was so busy even though the plane had not arrived and was being very dismissive The agent on the phone checked me in and I had them on speaker phone. I explained that to her and she goes policy is we can't let you on the flight because it's too close to departure. The same lady that told me I should have known in our previous encounter says says "you should have called earlier." I emphatically explain how when I'm checked in already and I'm on the phone with a United Employee. He was on speakerphone "are they not letting you board? You are checked in." She again says no and to talk to her supervisor and points. She says it's policy but then reluctantly walks over and let's me board as if she was doing me a favor.  Apparently policy didn't matter then and I wish the ordeal stopped there. When I get on the plane all of the bins are closed so I ask where can I put my bag. As far as I am concerned it could have been checked. The flight attendant gives me a bewildered how do I know look and ask what seat I'm in. It really didnt matter when I'm one of the last people on the plane and all bins are closed.  I go to my seat and open multiple bins only for her to to walk back and open one bin that has room and wasn't by my seat.

|  Punta Cana to Chicago. This return was so much better compared to our outgoing flight. This time the crew we dealt with were smiling, friendly and attentive. They served a meal which was quite good actually, them came by twice more during this 4.5 hour flight offering cookies and snacks. All in all they acted very professionally and we appreciated that. Its unfortunate that other UAL flight crews behave so differently IME like anything goes. I certainly hope UAL is listening and will realize that the interactions by their personnel overall represents the face of their product to the consumer and will emphasize that their crew make passengers feel valued, welcomed and wanted. Then I think most will be happy to return. But there is much work to be done.
| Orlando to Washington, D.C. Great flight with United, easy check in at MCO and nice staff all around. Plane was an older one, but the seat was comfortable and servcie was good.

|  Purchased business tickets for my wife for 1/21 and myself to travel on 1/19 from Richmond to Paris. The first United Airlines flight from Richmond to Dulles was 2 hours late thus I missed my Paris flight. My wife’s flight was 1.5 hours late and she missed hers. The United gate agents in Richmond, with the exception of 1,  were untrained, ineffective and mostly ignorant. My wife’s agent forgot to switch her luggage when she was rerouted through Germany. At age 67 , I have travelled on business and pleasure most of my life, but these 2 experiences rank as the very worst for both of us.
ReviewTitle: "the very worst for both of us"

FullReview: |  I flew with United Airlines Dec 26 from Toronto to Houston. We encountered weather problems or turbulence by Houston Airport or that was what I assumed. We circled the airport in the fog for 40 minutes with no communication from pilot or staff the entire time to let us know what was going on. Was an unnerving experience. On Jan 16 I again flew with United Airlines from Auckland to San Francisco. Again no communication from pilot or staff regarding the reason for the excessive turbulence. The stewardesses seemed to be very irritable and also the washrooms very dirty. The only thing said by the pilot was thanks for flying United after we landed.  Will not recommend this airline for any future trips for anyone

|  Montreal to Buffalo via Newark. I had a flight scheduled for 5:45pm on Jan. 21st, and 1 hour before the flight they decided to cancel it. I had work the next day. And of course, nothing was compensated. No hotel stay, no food, because it was weather related. I had to sleep in the terminal. I despise this sort of treatment. I will forever avoid United.

|  We flew 1st class from ORD-PUJ in the Dominican Republic. I must say the flight back was good and that will be posted in a different review but this one was appalling. We were in the first row and had a birds eye view of the flight attendant having what I will call a bad hair day. She put her long, stringy hair in bun, let it down and put it up again and so on a few times. That wasn't so bad but at least twice she ran her fingers through her hair and dropped dislodged hairs and goodness only know what else directly onto the cabin floor! I can't believe it but she did. I never saw her wash her hands and yes she served meals too. The breakfast was supposed to be eggs Benedict. Well there was no poached egg, it resembled a scrambled mishmash and the Hollandaise sauce was baked into the egg instead of being a sauce. So in sum the food was poor and the sanitary practices simply failed due to negligence.

| Cincinnati to Chicago. Worst plane ride ever and that says a lot considering it was also the shortest. Extremely small and uncomfortable plane. After telling me my carry-on bag was fine, they decided it was too big, as well as many other people, and made us leave our bags outside the plane without telling us where to get them. After the ride was over I had to search for someone to ask, where they made us all line up in the cold and wait for them. They may have actually told us, but whoever gave the instructions spoke such a poor excuse for English it was pathetic, and I really don't mind accents normally, as long as I can understand. They can't do the job if nobody can understand them and they just keep yelling and gesturing and even grabbing at my belongings because they can't compose a sentence to tell me what to do with them. I was also supposed to be in a row by myself, but out of nowhere the flight crew pulls out a seat behind the wall and blocks me in the aisle and completely blocks off the bathroom so nobody could use it and making one long row with no space in it. I would never willingly book with this airline.

| Miami to San Francisco. Once again, a disappointing product from United on one of the longest trancontinental routes in the country. Old plane. Old seats. No seat back IFE. WiFi did not work. The food in First class was respectable though. United - please upgrade your fleet!

|  Denver to Chicago via Detroit. Was charged $30 per carry on bag, had to check our 2 bags, as they wouldn't allow us to carry on proper size bags cuz we booked economy. When we complained was told we should of done it at the airport which was crazy as they were backed up so bad and had no time. It's a trap! Just don't fly United, I know we won't ever again!

|  Madison to Newark via Chicago. This morning, I arrived at the airport and waited in line to check my bag for 25 minutes. Once I finally got up to the counter the agent at my desk disappeared for another 15 minutes. She finally came back but said I would miss my flight because I was a few minutes late from the checked baggage cutoff time. The agent tried rebooking my ticket for me. I’m not sure if she was new or wasn’t trained on the system well enough because it took her a long time to rebook the ticket to the point where her supervisor had to jump in. Her supervisor told her to push me to the side and said that they would “deal with me later”. I waited another 20 minutes for them to get through the rest of the line. Once I finally got my ticket rebooked, the flight is not only not a direct flight, it’s also supposed to reach my destination 8 hours after my initial flight. First of all, I shouldn’t have had been put on hold just because there’s a long line to get through. Secondly, right before I was pushed to the side, the agent promised to put me on the next possible flight at 11 am. But after being pushed aside, I got put on the 1:50 pm flight. The inconsistency and empty promising is so unacceptable. I am being lied to and neglected by your staff. I have never experienced this with other airlines. Delta next door had the same amount of people in line and they got through the line 30 minutes faster than United. Delta in the past had allowed me to board my airplane still while my baggage goes on the next flight but United would not allow me to do that. I have lost 8 hours of my time to spend with my parents whom I have not seen in 2 years due to the your staff’s incapability to work efficiently. How could you possibly ever replace this valuable time I lost because of your inconsiderate employees. Thanks to United, I will now have 5 hours to cry at the airport. This experience is making me reconsider ever taking a United flight again. Especially seeing that comparison of service quality side by side with Delta.

|  Newark to Las Vegas. United Airlines isn’t my go to airline but sometimes I have to take it due to lack of alternatives. Whenever I do take it, I get reminded why I dislike taking it. In flight customer service has never impressed me. Flight attendants are unfriendly and unwilling to help. I got stuck with my small luggage because of lack of space in the business class. The flight attendant directed me to go to the back of the flight to find a spot when I was sitting upfront. This not only resulted a long delay for everyone but took me 15 minutes to get back to the front and just to find out I could’ve fit my bag in the overhead near my seat. Zero initiative to provide any help. Let me add laziness too to my description.

| I took United as domestic flight segment from EWR to AUS and back to IAD in December 2018 and had generally very good experience. There are many new machines, the staff were very polite. There is a large selection of free soft-drinks optionally served with ice cubes. I like the design and brand vision partly derived from Continental. Seats average, a bit tight. Unfortunately some delays occur often especially when flying from EWR.

| Washington to Greensboro. Not the first time I have had issues with my flights, always end up needing to wait extra time! Next time I need to choose a company to fly with, United Airlines definitely won’t be my first option!

|  Shanghai to Newark. I ordered the ticket a month in advance and had to transfer from Shanghai Hongqiao airport to Shanghai Pudong airport. When I arrived to check in the staff told me all seats were sold out. It was outrageous they didn't give me a refund prior to flying out they instead promised me a seat that wasn't empty I was furious. The airline messed up on my order and still had the nerve to upgrade someone's seat instead save your money and book elsewhere United Airlines treat their customers like a joke. The staff on board were attentive but the leg room seemed to be smaller than other aircraft. In addition, the food was dry and mediocre it was hard to swallow. I will no longer book through United Airlines after this ridiculous first experience with them.

|  Denver to San Francisco. Over the top service in business class right from check in to the Polaris lounge ( centurion eat your heart out) To the staff being so attentive and trying to get everyone taken care of. 2 hr rain delay at sfo... they apologized for rain. And then they announced that a few people were trying to make an international connections if everyone could stay in their seats so these people could get off first... and everyone listened. Well 1 very anxious couple defied the stewardess orders and walked to the exit area and sat right in front of it while we were still taxiing on the runway, the stewardesses were firm and did not escalate the situation.

|  Las Vegas to Halifax via Newark. These people are the most rude and selfish people I have ever dealt with. I am in the Canadian military and specifically asked before booking my flight whether we were covered for checked baggage. I was told that I am and so I booked with them. Now being at the airport they tell me they only cover for US and refuse to do anything to help me out. They were condescending, rude, and refused to help out with anything wanting me to pay over $300USD for my 3 bags. Eventually rebooked to Air Canada and I would recommend Air Canada to anyone.
Route: Las Vegas to Halifax via Newark

FullReview: |  Syracuse to Las Vegas via Chicago. United recently impressed me when I was promised a travel voucher and to be able to change flights by reservation agent. I confirmed the details multiple times. I asked if I would have to go to the gate and through security and he said no. The agent also said the voucher and changing flight was guaranteed and it was rare to be offered this. I showed up to the airport today with no bags (because I was guaranteed a voucher and to switch flights). Then I realized I was lied to. Lady at the ticketing counter in Syracuse was very helpful, but said that I was misinformed. I ended up spending over 2 hours between the ticketing counter and calling reservations today. I received a later flight but no voucher. I feel deceived and absolutely disrespected. There’s such a lack in their customer service experience and overall respect for people’s time, which is now something I can’t get back. I have now wasted non refundable minutes dealing with something I was promised multiple times. I will not be using United as my airline of choice and highly advise against using them.
Route: Syracuse to Las Vegas via Chicago

FullReview: |  Chicago to Los Angeles. One of the worst airlines I've ever flown on. Will never fly with them again. If anything goes wrong, be warned that they will not work with you to compensate. The service is horrible, their policies are worse. Very greedy airline, would never recommend.

|  Houston to Salt Lake City. The guy next to me was cool with switching with my wife so we could both take care of our kid. Then the stewardess came around and told us the baby couldn’t be in that isle because it was an emergency exit isle. That would make sense if it was, but it wasn’t an emergency exit isle. When I pointed this out the stewardess got mad, and made my wife and the other person switch back to their original seats. United do an attitude check on your people before hiring them thanks. Oh those maple wafers were so good!

| I had the worst flight of my life with United Airline! They retarded our flight from Houston to San Jose Costa Rica and they were trying to let us think it was because of the weather, but all other airline managed to make their flight that day. They canceled our flight because they were missing staff, but still they were saying it was weather. The flight was schedule for 9:15am on the next morning, but they still didn't had staff. They finally made the flight passes 11:00am. That flight was schedule originally the day before at 9:30pm. Furthermore, after cancelling my flight back before the 24hours allowed to cancel it they confirm that my flight was canceled, but did not refund it. I'm still trying to get the refund... Worst airline: United Airline
Route: San Diego to San José via Houston

FullReview: |  San Francisco to Portland. This was the worst flight in my entire life and I am 62 years old. I will NEVER fly United Airlines again. We started boarding on time and were about 1/2 full when they asked us to deplane for a maintenance issue. At first, we weren't told when they thought we might take iff. Then every 1/2 hr they would say it would be another 1/2 hr before we knew anything. I learned more about the problem in United's texts than from their Customer Service personnel. We finally were told it was ONE indicator light that wasn't working. After 2 1/2 hours they told people about another possible flight leaving at 7 pm. The problem with that was it was completely FULL & had people on standby. So you could give up a PAID RESERVATION for a seat on another flight with the slight possibility of getting on. This made no sense. They finally brought out free water and snacks but never bothered announcing this so by the time I'd heard about it they were all gone. They then changed our gate to a less comfortable location with fewer seats. People were seating on the floor. I've got health issues and this entire experience was awful . I usually fly with Southwest and I've never encountered anything like this. I understand that it is the holidays but United should have been better prepared for situations such as this. Think twice before flying United.

| Cancun to London via Houston. Never again! Placed me in a complete opposite of the plane from my wife even though I selected my seats! United staff when we arrived at Houston said no matter where we were going with our connecting flight I would have to collect our luggage - waited 20 minutes for luggage only to be informed we did not have to collect it! Nearly missed our connecting flight due the stupidness of staff.

| Houston to Saint Louis. I have never had a 50 pound bag completely lost. Somehow, United did it. The gentleman that helped me in STL was super helpful, but even he said that United workers in Houston were screwing up really bad. I do not think they care about their customers in Houston which is sad. I am disappointed.

|  Chicago to Houston. Miserable inconsiderate employees. Treated like cattle and shown no courtesy or customer service of any kind. Never fly this airline. Cheap prices maybe, poor training and courtesy nonexistent. Don’t do it.

|  Houston to Puerto Vallarta. Never again, and I’m not a picky traveller. Redirected due to weather/not enough gas. Airplane late, missed my flight to Guadalajara. United could not book me on the next two flights to where they were supposed to, so booked me to a different city the next day. I’m fine paying a bit to stay overnight, but now I’ll be in a different city and have to figure out a way to get to my final destination. Double accommodation and double the bus booked now and paid, and UA doesn’t even want to help by offering to pay anything, yet alone a taxi. UA we understand weather can’t be controlled, but if you can’t get me to my destination, shouldn’t that be compensated? I got a meal voucher though (laughs out loud, 24h limit). It’s 11pm and I’m tired, exhausted and fed up spending extra money, I’m not hungry and a meal voucher doesn’t cut it. I will never fly this airline again, as my travels may be ruined this time.

|  I had a round trip flight from Denver to Philly and back for the holidays. The trip to Philly wasn’t too bad other than a weather delay (not the airlines fault at all) and the rude flight attendant. However, upon checking into my returning flight I received an error that I didn’t exists as a passenger. I called the number provided and was informed that because I missed the train connecting me to Philly after my first flight (which I missed because of to the delayed flight) my return ticket was voided and I was no longer on the flight! I received no notification of this, not a text, email. And was not reimbursed at all. I spent 45 minutes on the phone with their Customer Service who then informed I would need to pay an additional $411 to have my ticket reinstated.(I had already paid 600 for this round trip) I’d rather hitch hike 1600 miles with strangers than fly United again. Happy holidays to me, right? I ended up having to spend another $525 I didn't have to get flight back with a different airline. I fly a decent amount having family and work locations all over the country, I strayed away from usual airline to save $100 bucks on this trip and it ended up costing me an extra $550 after all things in included. Worst travel experience of my life, even Spirit wasn’t this bad.

|  LaGuardia to Washington via Orlando. Worst flying experience ever. The airline Nickles and dimes you for everything made me take my grandbabys toys out of the boxes. Staff was every rude, my first time flying with this airline, and never again.

|  Newark to Tel Aviv. The worst experience of my lifetime! I was supposed to fly on 12/25/18 for a very short trip for a family reunion and my daughter's celebrations. My flight was cancelled when I arrived to airport (less than 3 hours before the flight) and the cancellation text message came from Expedia, not United! United did not even bother to let me know in advance so that I would not go to the airport for nothing! I hold the driver who brought us to the airport for a while to figure out what happened. At the entrance I was told by a United rep that the flight is still on, just the aircraft was replaced so I have to check-in again (I did online check-in the day before). So I let the driver go and was waiting in the line until I reached the check-in desk where I was told that the flight is cancelled and there are no seats on the replacement flight. Nobody apologized. None of the agents looked a tiny bit sorry about what happened and nobody rushed to help resolve the situation. It felt like a 3rd hand company in a developing country, not the biggest American airline. After lots of efforts I got a replacement flight a day after and with a several hours stop in Europe. I was not offered any compensation for the damage they caused to us as all our Israeli plans had to change. After spending quite a bit of time trying to find a way to submit a complaint I finally did it and received an automated message offering $200 e-ticket or bonus miles. I do not need any of them as I will do my best to never fly United again! What a horrible Christmas experience.

|  Newark to Los Angeles. Terrible experience, delayed over 5 hours! Not updating us what is happening! United service people were terrible and very rude. I will never fly with them again. Did not give food vouchers for evening flight. Just can’t believe this.

|  Newark to Mumbai. United airlines had the worst customer service on the ground. I flew on Christmas. But even accounting for the holiday rush, their services were just unbelievably bad! To begin with, they had a common check-in for ALL flights. To add to the chaos, everybody was supposed to check-in at the kiosk and there was absolutely nobody to help in case somebody got stuck. At one point 5 out of 6 kiosks were unable to complete the check-in, stranding people behind. There was a separate queue for travel assistance, which had about 20-30 people waiting and only 1 counter  was available for assistance. It took us about 1 hour 45 min to complete the check in and reach the security. On another note, I was traveling with my boyfriend and we wanted our seats together. We had selected the seats immediately after booking our tickets. The seats got reshuffled three times due to "a change in the plane" and "the system" reshuffled the seats such that our seats got separated. United surely needs to fix their "system" that is unable to do a simple one-to-one mapping and is somehow adding a random factor on its own. I hope United fixes these issues soon.

|  Burlington to Newark. The United flight was delayed 3 hours, and when we landed I received a message that my luggage did not arrive, it will arrive on the following flight. The customer service is terrible, lacking compassion and totally inefficient. My luggage did not arrive within 24 hours, as promised. 2 days later and I still haven’t received my suitcase. They have lied on the phone and miscommunicated between me and the driver service. What a disappointing and ugly experience. I would not recommend this airline to anyone.

|  Toronto to Oaxaca via Houston. Holding customers for ransom? I recently had an unbelievable experience flying to Mexico on United with a bike. Booked the flight several months back, checked with the United call centre on charges for taking a bike and confirmed what I'd read earlier on the United web site. Both made it clear that if the bike bag fell within weight and dimensional limits it would be charged simply as a second item of checked baggage i.e. $50. When I checked in at the airport, the United agent insisted that I owed an extra $200 (!) for the bike even though it came in under 50 lb limit and was the standard dimensions set out in the Airline's limits. No amount of back and forth would bring them round to honour the original terms. And curiously my two companions who had checked in a little earlier for the same flights also with bikes were charged much less - one paid $25 as it was his first and only item of checked luggage and the other was charged nothing for his bike as second item (his was in an identical Evoc bike bag and weighed just a little more than mine). The experience left a very bad taste. What can you do but pay up when you have already bought the ticket and will be leaving soon? This seems to be the kind of business practice you would expect of a dubious, disreputable business or one might experience in some part of the world where corrupt practices are more common.

|  On an 8 hour trip from Honolulu to Houston the flight attendants sprayed the cabin of the plane with a bad smelling air freshener with no regards to anyone’s health, including babies and younger children. Many people on the plane were coughing. I’ve never experienced this on an airline.

|  Sao Paulo to Houston. United Airlines have a lot of old planes still it seems. This is not necessarily a bad thing, I love these old 767s they have substantially more personal space (pitch and width) than newer aircraft. Friendly crew, decent food. I pegged an exit seat as a result of status gained through status matching. None of the airlines from the United States touch my preferred airlines in Europe Air France, Alitalia but United is now for me competitive with American and not so far behind Delta as it was.

| Flew United Airlines from Indianapolis to Denver. Took well over an hour from the original departure time to even begin boarding which caused many personal schedule errors to ensue after. I understand delays occur, however I have never experienced delays this long with any other company.

| I have yet to be treated this horribly! I have flown for work for the past 10 years on different airlines including United and this has been the worst experience. Since when are passengers treated with such distrust and since when is it ok for United employees to be this rude to passengers? Initially I was questioned about the size of my carry-on which I travel with all the time. She right away said to check it and I tried to put it in the size checker and I explained that I had placed my laptop in the outside pocket which is why it looks “thicker” so let me just put it inside the bag and it’ll be fine and she just said “if you check it you can’t check the laptop” and I replied “no, the point is I’m not checking it bc it fits” and she said “it’s doesnt fit so check it - I made an announcement earlier so you should know”. Firstly, the bag fit, and so she just walked away without saying anything and then secondly since when is it ok to “scold” me like I “should know”? Really? Then I cut my finger on the size checker and I asked a flight attendant for a bandaid and she said she can’t get one. I said I’m bleeding. She said she can’t leave the front and the first aid is in the middle. I said isn’t there a flight attendant in the middle and she said “yes but they are assisting someone else”. What kind of operation is this? Then later after 10 minutes she comes by and gives me a bandaid without a word. What kind of customer service is this?

|  Never warned about flight cancellations and was told it was confirmed the night before with no help from the desk. Was told there was a walmart and that was supposed to make up for it. Waste of time. Incompetence to the highest degree and a lack of care. Even told them I had orders to be reporting into for the military and all I got was an 'oh well' from the desk staff. Then when I tried to transfer flights they wouldn't because "they would lose money". United Airlines is a terrible airline, doesn't care about you or your money, and would rather you just stay put instead of getting you anywhere.
ReviewTitle: "doesn't care about you or your money"

FullReview: |  Houston to Minneapolis. There was no prior warning of our flight being delayed until five minutes prior to the plane boarding. Every 30 minutes they delayed our flight another 1/2 hour for a total of five hours. Then at 12:00am they announced our flight would be cancelled. They sent all 200 passengers to customer service where three employees worked to put customers in hotels. After 1.5 hour wait in line we were informed there were not hotel rooms left for the night and we were forced to sleep at the airport. There has been no compensation for our trouble and our seats for the flight we were booked on in the morning were all the way to the back. They upgraded the business class passengers to first class conveying they do not value the every day vacationer but cooperate business who frequently use their airline. I will never fly United again.

| This morning I encountered probably the worst customer service of my life. The person at the check-in desk was incompetent and rude. I had a valid document for travel to Mexico with an official green card stamp in my passport and she got confused and told me she has never seen this and decided to leave with my passport and go somewhere without even explaining her actions. When I confronted her and asked not to leave with my documents she said: "I won't be able to help you, I just can't deal with the attitude right now". When I finally made her talk to the supervisor and he looked at my documents and said "oh yeah that's ok". I wasted 40 minutes of my life. One star United, I think that becomes a new normal for you.
ReviewTitle: "the worst customer service of my life"

FullReview: |  Milwaukee to Leon via Houston. Today is a nightmare for us. We pay extra to leave Milwaukee early in the morning -  first we were delayed in Milwaukee for 3 hours then arrived in Houston delayed 3 hours. Arriving at night in Leon mexico. We had a wedding to attend and now we are not going to be on time. We talk to the staff from the airline they were rude. This is my first and last trip in this airline. Our worst trip ever.

|  Ottawa to Chicago. When I was at Ottawa my flights from Ottawa to Chicago and Chicago to Indianapolis both got cancelled. I went to the gate and the agent collected my boarding pass and the information on my flights. After that she assured me that she will rebook my flight to Indianapolis. Suddenly, she got up and made an announcement about passengers moving upstairs to rebook their flights. As the passengers were told to follow the person leading the way upstairs, she followed behind. I was with her as she clipped my boarding pass on her card board. Then when we reached upstairs I was still walking with her slowly matching her pace. We talked on the way and she only assured me that I am not to worry.  I reminded her that my boarding pass is with her and she simply handed me my boarding pass. I was now the last person in the queue. I waited for 2 hrs 30 min for my turn. She was around but my turn fell in with the other representative. I explained her my flight details and college scene again. She first told me that she will book me in the flight to Indianapolis via Washington. Then she told me that she will not be able to do that because I have two separate bookings and that she is not able to merge. In fact, she also told me that she will not be able to provide me with an accommodation when the passengers right next to me on the other counter same class ticket and same flight were being provided accommodation because they spoke on the helpline phone number. Now I am in the middle of an unknown place, Ontario without a place to stay and without any flight plans for the next day even when there are seats available with United airlines.

|  Buffalo to Los Angeles via Chicago. I booked my flight online and I had assigned seating for all my flight. United change my flight from LAX to BUF. Now I cannot do assigned seating. I am 320 pounds and I cannot sit in the middle seat. I may now be force to book another flight and lose $200+ on my previous flight. This is the worst experience I've ever had with a flight and I will never fly United again.
Route: Buffalo to Los Angeles via Chicago

FullReview: |  Houston to Denver. No frills but all okay and on time both legs and that's most that matters besides be safe and secure. Personal entertainment did not work on first leg IAH-DEN. Would love to be more rewarded for loyal costumers more.

|  Boise to Denver. How a company with such disregard for the consumer experience can survive is beyond me. Cancelled / delayed flights, overbooking punishing those who bought the tickets most recently (often due to emergency), absurd fees (flight change, baggage, minors traveling alone), and shoddy customer service (canned dismissive responses when you bring up concerns) make using this airline unbearable. I have sworn to never fly them again regardless of the cost difference. It is not worth it.

|  
Portland to Houston. We planned a normal flight and didn't realize there was a difference from "basic economy" and economy (let it be known when leaving this review there isn't even an option for "basic economy", just first class, business class, premium economy, and economy), and when I arrived for my flight I was forced to check my bag because a carry on and a personal item are not included, only a personal item. This forced me to pay an additional $30 for my already expensive flight. I would not recommend this airline to anyone unless they are planning a short trip where they don't need to pack actual cloths, otherwise you'll be blindsided by the additional fee(s). I've flown with several airlines and have never checked a bag, all other airlines allow a personal item and carry on. No one should be forced to read through all the fine print to realize a personal item and carry on is not included on an economy flight. I would not recommend United Airlines to anyone and will not be using their services in the future. 1/10.

|  Hartford to Tampa via Washington. Worst airline ever. The staff is rude, nobody cares about the passengers, etc. I bought a ticket and was not told I would have no choice of seat until after it was paid for. I have an anxiety disorder and of course was given a middle seat. Knowing I was going to have a panic attack, I tried to resolve this before the flight. Needless to say, United could have cared less and needless to say, I sure indeed had a panic attack in the middle of my flight. It was humiliating and could have been avoided if this airline cared. I will never fly them again, I don't care how much I have to spend next time!

|  Chicago to Dallas Ft Worth. Backward airline that struggled to meet customers needs. Simple flight delay from O’Hare, delay was nearly 2 hours. I requested a rebooking to OKC, and would deal with my car issue myself. I was told that OKC was too far and out of range for a transfer, but was offered Houston and San Antonio. Honestly, was not even sure how to respond to this backward logic. Looking at other reviews I am not surprised by the lack of service provided. Just to be clear, my flight was delayed due to maintenance required on the plane. Again, I do not understand how this “sneaks up and is unforeseen”.

|  Newark to Los Angeles. United is the worst. We bought economy tickets thinking we were getting a good deal. When we showed up at the airport, it turns out our ticket includes a personal item only, no carry on. Who travels across the country with just a purse? Our options were to pay $400 for the privilege of carrying on our carry ons or $120 to check them, meaning adding an extra 40 minutes to our thanksgiving commute. This is horrible customer service and basically extortion - we were left with no choice but to add a huge amount to our already expensive tickets. Never flying United again.

|  Mexico City to Chicago. The flight was perfect. The crew were very kind and helpful, but the food was awful. I ordered pancakes, and I was told that they didn’t have anymore (business class) but the only thing left was scrambled eggs (powdered yolks) . So I ordered them, and as soon as I had the first bite, I had to spit them as quickly as I could out of my mouth because the taste was so terrible.  Why can’t they make an effort to give good tasty food ? My wife and I were flying business class, but the food was not second, not third, but tenth class. I think that the airline should give the passengers what they pay for, and believe me, it’s not cheap. I hope that this review will be read by some authority working in United Airlines.

|  Seattle to Denver. How is it that all pets on all other airlines, except United, are $75? Why does united charge $125? That is more than my own ticket.  I am trying to understand this and this price is one way! So now my dog cost me over $300! Double what I paid for my flight. This is outrageous, never flying United again.

|  Rochester to Chicago. This is my first and last experience with United Airlines, they caused me to pay for my bag since they have different policy on their economy tickets, then I purchased two tickets for 2 different passengers and they were no where close to one another -  terrible customer service at the gate. I would never recommend them to anyone, AA will be first choice from now on.

|  Seattle to Charleston via Newark. Today I missed my sons family day because me and my wife have been stuck with no car. (In which we had reservations to pick up at 12 am after getting off the plane November 6, 2018). We didn't make it to the airport in Charleston till 1:30am they gave the car to someone else because we can't call up in the air. We have been up for over 24 hours. We are extremely exhausted and we are still sitting at this airport because we have to wait until a car comes available. Oh by the way it's 10:50 am November 7, 2018 I can't even think straight anymore so disappointing. The most important thing in my sons life and i missed it.

|  Angeles to Cincinnati via San Francisco. I flew 6 different times with United Airlines in the last few days and not one single flight has a working WiFi and all the staff said the same exact excuse. This misleading and false advertising they sold us a service with WiFi and they don’t even have WiFi on the plane. I don’t know how they get away with stuff like this?
Route: Los Angeles to Cincinnati via San Francisco

FullReview: |  Amarillo to Edmonton via Denver. Worst airline I've ever flown. Extremely bad on time performance. My flight from AMA to DEN was delayed for over 3 hours which would have resulted in me missing my connection in Denver. I had to reroute through Houston and ended up over 5 hours late. Every airline has delays but I have had more flight delays due to mechanical issues on United than any other airline by a large margin, both in total number and percentage. I bring an extra change of cloth when flying United because i can never trust it will get me to my destination on the same day. Only reason I still occasionally fly United is due to limited selection of airline to several smaller airports I have to fly into for work. I would never fly United for any personal trips nor would I recommend this airline to anyone else. To me, if i can't get there by another way, it is not worth going. Even for work, I am seriously considering flying into other airports up to 5 hours away on Delta and drive from there. It is that bad.

|  New Orleans to Newark. I have purchased tickets on line from United air web site in economy we got to the airport they treat us like the enemy because we purchased economy tickets then made us check in our Carry ons and charged us for them. When we tried to talk to that lady that was checking us I was told to file a formal complaint, as we were under the understanding that we can have one Carry on each. The manager walked away and would not talk to us. Just walked away like we were not there. Very rude to have someone like that to represent United Airlines, I was very disappointed in United. It took one hour and fifteen minutes just for the attendants to come around with water and that is on a two hour flight.
ReviewTitle: "made us check in our Carry ons"

FullReview: |  On October 31st 2018 I had a flight booked through United Airlines to return to Baltimore from Cabo San Lucas, Mexico. Booking through United Airlines was the worse mistake I’ve ever made. Once we left SJD airport (Cabo) at 12:05 pm everything seemed normal until we got closer to (IAH) Houston we were suppose to arrive there at 4:30 pm to make it to our connecting flight at 7:45pm and we were supposed to reach our destination at 11:38 but the pilot said we had to go to San Antonio for a little bit until the storm cleared up when we landed in San Antonio to get more fuel he then told us that since he exceeded the maximum number of hours to fly for the day which was 12 hours that we had to wait for the new crew to board which will take about 45 minutes. So went through customs as instructed and got some food because they told us that we won’t be able to leave until 8:15 pm. While waiting the airline staff told us that they will have to reschedule our flight but they will put us in a hotel room once we reach Houston, TX.Then we start waited and they they boarded us on the plane around 10 pm to wait some more. Finally we take off around 10:30 pm and reach Houston around 11:30 and we spoke with a customer service representative and she said they will not give us a room because it was weather related but the pilot told us he ran out of hours to fly for the day. So then we got stuck staying in the Houston airport overnight waiting for our flight at 12:00pm. Then around 10:00 am I received notification that our plane wasn’t going to arrive until 2:06 since they had to find a plane for us. So then I spoke with another rep and she said they weren’t going to do anything for the inconvenience or even offer a food voucher. And we were stuck at the airport with nothing since our bags already made it to Baltimore. The thing that makes me even more disgusted is the fact that my cousin that flew through Southwest leaving a few minutes after us was able to get from Cabo to Houston without any delays and she made it back to BWI by 11:45 pm on 10/31 while me and my other 3 cousins made it to BWI at 5:30 pm on 11/1. This has been a horrible experience all together and the staff of United is very unorganized and they lie and tell their passengers anything to get them hush while not delivering on their promises. I will never ever fly with United Airlines ever again and believe me my family and friends will not fly with them either.

| Horrible experience: We paid 60 dollars for our checked in baggage and mine was slightly over by 0.5 pounds, while my boyfriend's had almost 1 pound less weight than was allowed. We were made to unpack and repack two times until we had the weight evened out between our suitcases, which was a lengthy and embarrassing experience. I understand that there is a weight limit, but with this slight overweight in my suitcase it was really a question of whether one or two jeans go in my suitcase or my boyfriend's. Really petty, will try to avoid United Airlines in the future.

|  This is not about the flight, this is about the Customer Service. I booked a flight one month ago on United to Sydney. When I went in to make a matching reservation the site stated a change had been made to my itinerary and to give them a call. When I gave them a call they said I had to pay $300 more for my ticket, they also wanted me to pay a change fee. This is not right, I did not cancel my ticket, they cancelled my ticket and I should not have to pay more when they changed my ticket and I had no say at all. I switched from Southwest to United about two years ago because I thought I got better Customer Service and flights, I was wrong, United has continually gone downhill in the last two years and I will be switching back to Southwest and any over seas travel will not be on United. They are dishonest and to not care about the customers at all. If I hadn't checked the ticket who knows how much extra they would have charged me on the day of the flight.

| London to Auckland via San Francisco. Plane very basic, none of the long haul creature comforts that are offered on other airlines eg no toothbrush, eyemask, socks (earphones given if asked for). Most importantly no usb / charge socket. TV the size of a cell phone that was hard to watch but had a reasonable selection of programs and movies. Staff however were very friendly and food was to a good standard, regularly offered drinks.
Route: London to Auckland via San Francisco

FullReview: | San Francisco to New York. First, they don't use our Known Traveler Number for our tickets so we were denied of using our TSA Pre and had to wait in the regular line. Then we had to pay 55 dollars for our carry on bags since they had no overhead space (all I was carrying was that one carry-on). Prior to passing security we paid 25 dollars for a personal bag. (Someone next to us had to pay for their carry on as well and were not happy). My sister's monitor for the entertainment system did not work. I don't want to put every employee of this airline in the same pot but the ones at our gate were not professional and my sister and I heard them laughing at us while we headed down to the plane. I never write reviews. Worst airline out there. I will never fly with this garbage airline again.

|  Chicago to Fort Lauderdale. Horrible - every time I fly this airline it takes forever to board, or there’s a issue with the plane resulting sitting at the gate for an hour. I had a business meeting with important clients and I thought I’d give United another chance. Word to the wise if you need to be on time somewhere, use Southwest; fast boarding, and fast take off. If you like waiting on the tarmac, use United.
ReviewTitle: "sitting at the gate for an hour"

FullReview: | This is by far the worst airline in the US. I have flown on it multiple times and every time I regret it. The seats are uncomfortable, they always delay and cancel flights and their staff are not helpful at all. Today I arrived at the airport with my sister and asked if I can check in with her. They refused, checked in my bag (under weight) then weighed her bags and realized that hers was over, but by then we didn't have mine to shift the weight. We moved way out of the way and attempted to move things to the carry on, but their employee just stood above us insisting we go to the designated bag opening area and refused to understanding that our flight is close to departure time. Then I literally ran all the way to the gate and told them my sister was on the way and their first response was to look for alternative flights, an option I had to insist on rejecting. Now I'm sitting on the plane and it's not even moving, they're doing maintenance work.

|  Denver to Philadelphia. My complaint is with customer service and lack of response. Both my wife and I are Mileage Plus Explorer members for several years and were charged $25 each way for baggage. The process to get reimbursed is now approaching two weeks and nobody with any common sense can correct. $25 each way is not a big deal but can't imagine how a major problem would be handled. As a frequent flyer with United will be taking my business elsewhere and giving away my miles so I don't have to deal with incompetence

|  Singapore to San Francisco on the Boeing 787. There were numerous seats that were empty, so I had the whole row of 3 to myself. The selection was good for the in flight entertainment. The adjustable tint windows are a good touch. The food/beverage service was the most rushed I have ever had on any Int'l flight. Rather unprofessional to rush the passengers on a long flight like that. The dinner sucked too with this noodle chicken concoction that was awful. The mid flight snack was a very small sandwich and half a kit Kat. Also the socket for phone charging below the seat didn't work. Overall flight was good with the exception of the food/beverage service.

|  Honolulu to San Francisco. Seats: 3x4x3. Extremely cramped and limited space for luggage in your seating area. Does no accommodate all body types, it feels like they think everyone is 5'4" and 150 pounds. This is a 5 hour flight and no entertainment unless you download their app on your smart phone. I do not recommend this airline at all. I have flown countless times all over the U.S. and in Canada and Mexico. This is without a doubt the worst airline I have come across

|  Cancun to Houston. Really poor service towards economy class passengers. I don’t expect first class treatment but I do expect good customer friendly service because at the end of the day I am a customer too.

|  San Jose to Pittsburgh via Denver with 39 mins connection time. I kindly asked the flight attendant about my connecting flight to Pittsburgh. I was concerned whether I could make my connection. She then asked me “Why would you book a flight so close to one another?” in a disrespectful tone. How does that address my concern?  It’s no one’s business. Moving forward, I would appreciate if flight attendants would answer the question they are asked and address the concern.
Route: San Jose to Pittsburgh via Denver

FullReview: |  I am writing this letter furious with United Airlines for what I am being put through without my consent. Yesterday I arrived to my flight 25 minutes prior to scheduled boarding time. I  find out I could not get my bag on the flight because the cut off is 30 minutes prior to boarding. Missing the cut off by 5 minutes and with no other flights out that night I agreed upon taking the morning flight out. I arrive to the airport at 5:20. I walk right up to an agent showed them my new boarding pass and he then pointed his finger to the kiosks and told me I had to go over there. My boarding pass then does not read on the kiosk so I then have to wait for the one man working all of the kiosks In the airline while The agents continued to talk amongst themselves behind the desks. Finally the man comes to help me and then tells me I have to check in with an agent and my flight is leaving in 30 minutes to get my bag on. I walked to the desk and quickly explained that I need to get this bag on that I am going to miss my flight.  I Demanded someone to Help me and another lady told me that she could help me so I ran over to her. She put mne on the next flight without telling me and checks my bag. I am now running through TSA and  get to the gate at 6am to see the door close and I begged them to open it back up and they told me you are already put on the next flight.
| Denver to New York. Sitting at Denver airport, flight is 25mins late. No announcement or update from anyone. The crew are just as confused as the passengers. Not a great start.

|  Tucson to Houston. I'll try and summarize, my actual review I wrote was over 5000 characters. Both of my flights were canceled, the one coming home forced me to get a hotel in Houston. Trying to get questions answered, I called, emailed, left voice messages, and all I got was I can't help you try another department. I paid for the front row both direction and was given a ticket towards the back of the plane. Even with the confirmation email in hand I had problems getting the seat I requested and paid for (they were empty). The planes had no entertainment, no radio, nothing, I would have been fine with this if the ticket wasn't $500, but more in line of $200. Both flights were morning flights and the served cookies as the snack, really who wants cookies at 8 am. The flight crew came by once to hand out the cookies and a tiny drink just enough to get your mouth wet craving more and once to collect trash at the very end of the flight. After countless attempts to get answers and solve my issues I had to threaten a credit card dispute to get a response. What did the offer? A worthless voucher that would have cost me more money if I could have even used it.

|  Beijing to Chicago. Overall pretty good though United Airlines has a problem with lack of professionalism displayed by their FA's. The food and IFE were pretty good. The 2-4-2 cabin configuration was a bit cramped but not too bad. Seat comfort was ok though storage space was limited. This was a Polaris class flight BTW. We got off to a bad start before taking off when of all people the lead FA grabbed my wife purse to store it without saying a word. When my wife said she needed meds for her purse the FA turned this into power trip asserting her authority. I spoke with her before take off and told her we did not appreciate her approach. After all its not her purse and a simple explanation would have been in order vs. turning this into an argument. I also reminded her we had spend "a lot of money" for these Polaris biz seats and expected proper courtesy. To her credit she apologized and was most attentive during the rest of the flight. However I heard two other FA's gossiping about passengers with backpacks in a demeaning way. Unfortunately the FA's as a whole have a long way to go on terms of professional behavior. They could learn this valuable lesson from star alliance parties like ANA, Asiana and Thai whose FA's show true value towards the passengers.

|  Chicago to New York. I had a small personal item and suit. They asked me to check in one of those items because they are both considered personal items. I usually travel AA, but for unavoidable reason I had to fly United airlines for this trip. I have used other airlines with the same situation and they always give me a break because it’s just a suit and goes in the hanger closet. So I shoved my suit in to small bag because I didn’t want to pay for such inhumane thing. Even the FA’s at the gate seemed rude. This is the last time I’m flying United airlines. Never again. Very disappointed.

|  No room for carry on luggage was very inconvenient! We were not even the last group to board and they forced everyone to check the rest of their carry on luggage without letting any of us use the space under the seats in front of us to store necessities. I only had one carry on item as did my husband and was not permitted to attempt to fit it on the plane. When we got on the plane it was probably over 100 degrees and miserable. I saw plenty of room under the seat in front of me for my bag. I was reduced to carrying around my necessary medications and items in a trash bag so I wouldn’t lose anything. Very disappointed with this experience. Step it up United. I think incentive should have been offered from the beginning to those willing to check bags in order to not have this issue if it is known that your plane cannot accommodate the permitted carry on items or that people should be required to only store one item in overhead and one under the seat. Fix the problem.

|  San Francisco to Honolulu. As I was checking in a bag I arrived 3.5 hours before my departure time which was 2.05pm from San Francisco to Honolulu. We were then delayed 2 hours because the WiFi didn’t work. We had to sit on the plane whilst this was being fixed. Then we got onto the runway and a passenger in the seat behind me noticed a panel on the left wing was flapping, the air hostess said she’d check it out with the captain and then she came back and said ‘this isn’t right, the captain has said he needs to check it out’ - we were on the runway how did this not flag up before! This fault then left us delayed 1 hour, then 2, then 3 all the way through until 1.40am in the morning. I was offered a full refund - to which I wanted to take - but I was told that there was no way my checked bag would be leaving the aircraft so it’d be flying to Honolulu without me. This was the start of my travels so that bag had all my possessions in, including my medication! I was told I would not be able to retrieve my medication or bag! I explained to them that I wanted the refund as the delays were beyond a joke, to the extent that one of the managers from United airlines said ‘this has never happened to United airlines’. In the end we took off at 2am, I felt very forced to stay on the flight and I was told I would be compensated. The customer care team offered me a measly $150 e-ticket for another united airline flight - i explained how I am from England so I wouldn’t be able to use it. And in any case $150 wouldn’t get me far! I asked for the cash refund that I was originally offered hoping that someone in the customer care team would understand my frustration - but no they didn’t care at all. The e-ticket offered is laughable - my flight cost £270 which equates to about $350 so this $150 offered is a joke. Shame on you United Airlines , poor communication and poor customer service.

|  Chicago to Denver. The gate attendant told passengers that purses were considered a personal item and that my carry on luggage needed to be checked. That has never happened to me before and I fly frequently on United from Denver to Chicago all the time. I got on the airline and asked the flight attendants if they changed something and told them what happened and they both stated that is was “personal preference to the gate attendants” as to what items can be brought on or not. I would think it would have to be based on the airplane itself? She was very rude and it should be a uniformed response.
ReviewTitle: "my carry on needed to be checked"

FullReview: |  Sao Paulo to Houston via New Orleans. United Airlines has the worst customer support in regards to missing baggage. My wife has been told for the past week that another passenger retrieved her luggage from the terminal carousel and that this passenger would likely have to return her bag in order to retrieve the proper bag since it was the only one left. We were told this for nearly a week. Then today we find out that the next day from the initial missing date, that passenger sent his brother to retrieve the luggage. Best part, luggage was given with first securing my wife's bag. This guest claims his brother did not grab any other luggage. We are told this a week later when prior to today we were told that we were waiting for this guest to return the luggage. This is beyond unacceptable. We were given no update that this had occurred until a week later! Their solution: file a police report so they can "process" the claim and access camera footage. This is unacceptable. My wife had priceless sentimental items from her family in Brazil that she will never get back. Thanks United your outsourced customer service was so helpful in making our life miserable for a week before we found out the truth.
Route: Sao Paulo to Houston via New Orleans

FullReview: |  Eureka to Los Angeles via San Francisco. I'm a bit disappointed. I spent a lot of time planning my trip down to see my mom, who has terminal cancer, only to find out the day before that my flight is cancelled. I had to reschedule for two week out, and lost my deposit on my hotel because of the short notice. Now, I have to wait two weeks more to see my mom, when she could pass at any time, and shell out even more money for a hotel. Not cool, United.
Route: Eureka to Los Angeles via San Francisco

FullReview: | Every time I have flown United in the last four months (5 separate flights) the plane has been delayed. This last time, it was delayed 2 hours leaving and coming back we were stuck on the ground right outside our gate for 35 minutes. I understand that often there are issues outside their control, but it seems unlikely that 5 times within the past four months was all out of their control. When there are problems they are not transparent and give very little information about what you can expect going forward. Up until now I have been flying them because they have had the best prices, but I would much rather pay more and not have to deal with this as often. And if this does happen with other airlines, I am always given more information. Not worth the money I’ve saved.

|  Cancun to Seattle via Houston. Worst airline I’ve ever dealt with, we were delayed an hr and a half. Rushed through customs ran all the way to the gate showed up 15 minuets before departing and where denied boarding. Costumer service refused to help us with 3 little kids left us with 3 little kids to sleep in airport with no vouchers or any help, and they lost are check in bags. I fly all over the country for work and have never had any airline treat customers so poorly. It’s sad they are allowed to stay in business. All I can say is never fly United they don’t care for the people who keep them in business.

| Munich to Washington. Reviewing United is not really easy. It is a huge airline and it is just not fair to judge them by just one experience. Fortunately I flew United in a couple of opportunities so I am able to provide a couple of reviews. In this one it is about Biz Class on an "old" B777. Well it is just one D Experience. Having a Biz Class with 2-4-2 configuration is just not serious. Seat too tight to sleep. Plane is quite old. Too many passengers for a crew that is however very nice. Food is decent. Entertainment is very good. Overall not very comfy for Biz Class flight. Look for B787 Dreamliner Review for a better customer experience.

|  Chicago to Oklahoma City. Terrible personnel out of the Chicago O’Hare Airport. Would not let me board the flight, gate attendant stated she saw me chanting (cheering for football, not yelling) in the sports bar across from the gate. Missed my morning meetings and basically got told by United Airlines Management to screw myself. I can assure you I was of no concern to that flight and will never ever again waste valuable money flying your airline. I wish I had the exact names of the individuals so someone who knows how to operate business at United could try and help solve their desperate need for people who don’t have massive power-trips by use of authority they have zero of. Bunch of goofs. I will never book a trip with United Aurlines again.

| New Orleans to Indianapolis. I was very concerned when I broke my foot a few weeks before or trip and had surgery. I was non-weight-bearing and had a knee scooter. We called United two nights before the flight and they immediately did everything to be accommodating, changed my seat for free, changes my husband to be near me, described the process for boarding and leaving plane. We boarded four flights on that trip and everyone acted amazing, it was so easy, I am so grateful. Would definitely fly United again.

|  Los Angeles to Denver. First off customer service is terrible. Everyone was telling us something different and we could not get a solution for anything. We had a flight going from Los Angeles to Denver from there to our final designation which was Columbus. Our flight was delayed due to mechanical issues four and half hours which we would miss our other flight. There were two flights with Delta airline that would get us there on schedule but no one was willing to help and made us wait 2 hours so then we couldn’t make that flight. Now we are having to take an overnight flight which we did not want and we get nothing in return for this crisis. We even have to pay another baggage fee because we got transferred to a different airline. I would never fly this airline again in my life nor recommend this airline to anyone I know.

|  New York to Orlando. This was a pleasant flight. The flight attendant was fun and friendly and the seats were quite comfortable. The wifi was also surprisingly a bit reliable and the land service was a breeze including the boarding procedures. I would fly with United again. Also, the airline is quite generous when it comes to juice portions as they serve the whole cans and nit just on a plastic glass.

| The plane had a mechanical problem, we were repeatedly asked to stay on the plane. After two and a half hours we were told the plane was fixed and that we would be taking off. 30 minutes later we were told they didn't have any flight attendants and if we waited a few minutes the replacement flight attendants were in the airport and on their way. After another hour of waiting we were told they couldn't get flight attendants and deboarded the plane. When we got off the plane we were asked not to stand in line and that they would call us by name and that they would give us a hotel voucher so we could come back in the morning to fly. After waiting more than an hour they asked everyone to get in line, then they ran out of hotel vouchers so had to sleep on the floor. United was completely unprepared, how could they not know if the repair took longer than 2 hours their flight attendants would time out. How did they not already have a back-up plan in case the repair took longer than 2 hours. I was second in line when they asked us not to be in line, why would they announce for us to get out of line and then tell us we have to get back in line and then tell most people, sorry there's no hotel. Several of the United staff were clearly upset and they just stopped helping people and when I finally got to the front I was treated poorly. I was asked why am I here and when I told them about the flight delay they said they didn't know anything about it and that they had just got there. I asked for my hotel voucher and they had to check to see if they could help me. I received a hotel voucher and by the time I got to the hotel there was enough time for 2 hours of sleep. United did a terrible job of managing the situation.

|  Chicago to Phoenix. Where do I begin, I can’t even find anything positive to say! The worst airlines ever everything was bad. Very uncomfortable seats and extremely rude staff. You can’t even ask them a simple question they literally just yell at you and don’t even use manners. I’d never fly with United ever again.

|  Edinburgh to Charleston via Washington. The flights to Edinburgh were ok but the planes we were on were very old and filthy. I used the warm towel they provide before the meal service to wipe off the center console between the seats and it was black. Yuck! The flight attendants were nice and the food was fine. Our return flights were not good. Our transatlantic flight was cancelled but we were not notified until we were standing in line to check in. We got a nice hotel room amd meals and the flight the next day was on time. But again the plane was filthy, the blanket smelled like body odor and had holes in it, and the wool throw smelled like a wet dog. There is no way those had been cleaned between uses. Again the center console was visibly dirty. I paid almost $5000 for this? The flight attendants were unfriendly and we were made to feel that we were an inconvenience for them. Our connection was in Newark and the plane we were supposed to leave on was diverted to another airport. Flight was delayed for hours while we waited for another plane. That one was United Express and that plane was very old and the interior was not maintained. My husband wents to the lavatory at the back of the plane and said there was a crack in the interior plastic. Part of my armrest was missing. I have to wonder what the state of the mechanics on these aged planes is like if the interior that is visible to the customers is so bad. I will avoid United Airlines whenever possible in the future. Think twice before you book with them.

|  Lufthansa/United failed to put my luggage on the airplane in Munich, for some unknown reason. Despite filing a claim, my luggage was still sitting in Munich three days later. Eventually, they flew it to Charlotte, NC where I had stayed one night upon my arrival before traveling onwards. I called every night to track the progress (or lack thereof) of my luggage. Even though I had updated the address from the address of the first night's hotel to the new location, every single time I called they had the address of the first night's hotel. Three days after my luggage arrived in Charlotte, I called for the 7th time because I still did not have my bag. They told me it had been dumped off at the hotel where I had stayed 5 nights before, despite the fact that I'd updated the address over and over. So now my luggage is at some hotel I stayed at 5 nights ago that I am not planning to return to. After an hour on the phone with United this evening, he's told me (for the 5th day in a row) that I should have my bag by tomorrow. United is incompetent. Over and over I heard them say, "I apologize for that, ma'am." It would seem that they've all be trained to deal with issues in this way, rather than by actually sorting them out. Very, very unhappy with United/Lufthansa and not fly with them again, even if it means paying extra to fly on another airline.
Route: Munich to Charlotte via Amsterdam / Chicago

FullReview: |  Denver to Philadelphia. The plane was delayed because of a warning light about a fuel pump after the flight was fully loaded. It then took 20 minutes to get a mechanic and another 20 minutes to figure out the warning didn't matter and we could fly anyway. "its a redundant system", they told us. The experience was made worse by the fact that there was no air conditioning during the period of the delay on a hot day in Denver. The airplane was not cleaned after arrival in Denver from San Francisco. I was stepping on crackers left on the floor and there was garbage left in the compartment on the back of the seat. My family flies UA regularly but this had me thinking I should look for alternatives now whenever I can.

|  Tokyo Narita to Hobbs via Houston. I traveled alone with my 10 month old daughter both ways. No flight attendant helped me out in any way like putting luggage up in the cabin, picking up her toys for me, or even just being friendly. Everyone treated me like I was a hassle to deal with. One attendant refused to give me my bassinet because service had started, even though I had already been waiting for an hour. It only takes a few seconds to latch it on. One flight attendant actually made eye contact with my smiley daughter and waved, which was nice. One Japanese male attendant who I spoke to in Japanese, replied to me in English even though (he was speaking Japanese to the other staff so) I know he spoke Japanese. Why not speak back to me in Japanese? That is just plain rude. Other than that, after experiencing JAL last year, I thought the food was extremely disappointing. I also specifically made a phone call just to request a bassinet, but when I went to check in, there was no such request. I was baffled. I can’t say how disappointed and annoyed I was about the staff on both flights. If you are traveling alone with an infant, they will treat you like an inconvenience.
Route: Tokyo Narita to Hobbs via Houston

FullReview: |  I am a mom of 2 kids flying today from Dallas to Chicago. United asked me to reschedule the flight due to bad weather. After rescheduling my flight they sent a message stating that now this flight has been cancelled. We tried to book again the previous one but it was full at that moment of time. It's a terrible day for me, due to long weekend we had so many plans and all have been cancelled last minute. My elder daughter is so disheartened. The customer service representative will just say apologies and won't even give any benefits to you.
