Please don't book any flight with United Airlines if you are traveling on long weekends or holidays.

| Hartford to Tampa via Chicago. First let me start by saying if United is your only option for an airline you may want to strongly consider driving to your destination, you will likely get there quicker. Second when your flight is canceled 90 minutes before departure because the aircraft is “not available” United will never tell you why, so do not ever expect any type of compensation for your loss of time or other expenses. Lastly, not only will you ever hear and apology, but instead the agents are rude and act like they are doing you a favor for rebooking causing you to lose an entire day of your time. Never again my friends, and yes please do use my real name! I rarely ever leave poor reviews but this is more than justified!

|  San Francisco to Frankfurt. Worst airline in the world is United Airlines. I'm a gold member for many years. The airlines constantly has flight delay, extremely bad or worst customer services - bad attitude of gate agent, attendants, and all known to everyone the worst food services among all the airlines I've experienced. I fly often with European and Asian airlines, even latin american airlines, all I have received much better services than from United. This is the latest experience I had just 2 days ago traveling from SFO to Reykjavik connecting at Frankfurt. Notified in the morning of departure, flight was delayed for 1 hour 15 min. I have 1 hour 35min connection at Frankfurt originally. Got to airport, the check-in agent said the flight should take off per new time and will arrive only 30min than original. It turned out flight was late departure for 2 hour 15min, and arrived 1 hour 10 min later than planned. And got text message at FRA saying they put me on the flight next day midnight arrival to Iceland. That is 1 and half day later. I only going to be at Iceland for 3 days. Then to make things worse, they couldn't get my baggage transfer to the new flight that I had switched to at FRA airport. Now I'm stuck at Iceland without any clothes and can't get out in the cold weather. Here is the contrast, at the SFO airport, a gate agent of United, at the elite / premium line, was extremely rude. I hand over my passport and he handed back and said "open to the photo page". With 1 hour delay, and line up, and even at the premium line, this is United's attitude. And to compare to the agent of Lufthansa airlines at FRA airport gate, the 2 ladies was very friendly, and went out of their ways to help me, and put me on a same day flight connecting to Iceland only 5 hour later than my original flight. They didn't send me to the United customer service, which is what I would expect any gate agent or airline services in US airports would do. They made many phone calls while asking me to wait and took care of everything and handed over my new boarding pass and told me they've notified baggage handling of my new flights.

| Charleston to Houston. I paid for a 7:00a.m flight not 8:15a.m flight. Every time I fly United it’s never on time. I would recommend Delta or Southwest. United is a joke. If you would like to land late every time you fly, then fly United.

| Booked to fly Baltimore to Syracuse. I cannot say enough negative things about United Airlines. This is is the second review I’ve left in the last four hours because I have very little to do since arriving in Newark. Delayed flights. Terrible customer service. Save yourself the headache. Every single time I don’t fly Southwest, I regret it. Do not make mistake I have made.

|  Rochester to Burlington. Absolute worst airline you could fly on. Found out our flight was over an hour delayed after arriving at the airport, however we needed to ask if this meant we would miss our connecting flight. Staff was completely unsympathetic. Gave us 2 options both would have us arrive at our destination a little less than 24 hours after our scheduled time. On top of that, the attendant was unsure if we would get a refund if we cancelled the flight. Again, completely unsympathetic. It’s 2018 United, try and figure out a better flying schedule so your flights don’t get delayed. In the future, I would happily spend extra money if this means I will not ever have to fly on United again.

|  Denver to San Diego. On July 22, 2018, I registered for the United MileagePlus Reinstate Challenge. It was my understanding that if I took a qualifying flight, then I'd reinstate 90,000 miles. However, after I took my qualifying flight, United told me that only 1,500 miles were reinstated. Given that they charged my $100, I asked for a refund since it was not worth paying $100 for $1,500 miles, but they refused. Their reinstatement challenge is a fraud so don't register for the program!

|  Houston to London. Worst return travel that never happened just because they were not able to match first name from a boarding pass to the name given on the passport. Instead of checking the surname on both the travelling documents and providing every possible proof that it was a booked by a family member who gave my Arabic initial instead of my actual first name. Every personal detail I entered and gave them such as passport no. DOB, Expiration date and ticket details all matched, but they still didn't let me go through. I'm baffled and wondering as to why didn't United rectified my ticket when I have given them my passport details and all. They took me to the TSA and adding salt to my injury, they kept me waiting for an hour, took me back to United Airlines and asked me to verify her details which the customer service on the phone did, but the United Airlines rep on the desk at the airport refused to verify it. The customer rep on the phone spoke to the rep at the desk and he still refused me to travel back. They have sucked the money out of me not only for the return ticket and $100 extra for an extra luggage I was supposed to take back to London today.

|  Portland to San Francisco. Worst airline to travel. They will try to suck money out of you in every possible way. They charged me extra $50 for 2 bags that were allowed free to carry on by all other 5 airlines in the itinerary. Also they insisted again and again that the “kind of ticket class” I booked, they are doing me a favor for everything. I am not sure how they treat economy passengers but it felt insulting at one point. It was unfortunate that I booked tickets through United Airlines. But I will not repeat this mistake again in future, it’s a lesson learned for me.

|  I was heading to Newark airport from Honolulu, with a layover in Denver. An electrical malfunction occurred on the flight causing the plan to land early in San Francisco. When I arrived at the airport, United Airlines' customer service could not find my reservation, they lost my luggage, and could not send me back on the same day. Please do not ever fly with United. It's really never worth the cheap price.

|  I was traveling with my family to London and was all set to comeback on Aug 9th. Out of the blue I got a text 3h before flight departure that my flight from LHR to EWR was canceled due to weather.  The weather could not have been more picure perfect in London and same was the case in EWR. Upon probing the customer care, they admitted that it was mechanical failure. The reason they say weather is that then they are off the hook. They could only find flight to fly the following day. Now I went from direct flight to connection through Frankfurt. I had to spend one additional day in hotel, food, clothing all purchased at my cost. Unfortunately, my flight next day was also delayed. The guys in Lufthansa said that my connection in Frankfurt was fine. I missed the connection. Now I contacted United. They said it was not their issue anymore and I have to deal with Lufthansa. Lufthansa put me now through Denmark. Fine print: My flight from Denmark to EWR was standby and Lufthansa said that it was confirmed. We go to Copenhagen to find this hard truth. Called United and as expected they passed the buck to Lufthansa who passed the buck to SAS and who in turned passed it to United. With great difficulty my family and I made it back to USA, The SAS flight was horrible. Old plane, poor service, charge for even a soda. Horrible! I came back and filed a complaint with United. They make their feedback site so restrictive that you cannot explain details or upload bills properly. They dont even have a contact number to follow up. When I didnt hear back from United and called Mileageplus service, they basically said that wait your turn and we will call you when we get to it. What arrogance and callousness. Is this customer service? I have had it. I will make every effort not to fly United. But again, do we have a choice anymore. They all consolidated and ensure that they compete to provide the worst service at the highest cost possible. So much for free market economy!

|  Ontario to San Francisco. Never flying with them again! They made me check in my carry on, they said it’s part of their policy and made me pay for it! On top of that the flight was delayed. My last time flying with them. The staff was not friendly at all.
ReviewTitle: "made me check in my carry on"

FullReview: |  New Orleans to Newark. This was a nightmare. Almost every single person we encountered with this airline were rude and snappy. We couldn't check in online because apparently you can't fly Economy with a carry on any more. When we asked about it at Customer Service, the employee was rude and dismissive. I understand it's 4am but there is no need for my family and I to be treated with disrespect. I have never experienced anything like this and hopefully never will again because I now utterly refuse to fly United.

|  San Francisco to Denver. Absolute joke. Left us on the ground for 2 hours with no updates and no clue what was going on. Then the crew started walking around offering water, as some sort of compensation for a complete lack of communication. Never flying United again.

|  Newark to Atlanta. The worst experience I could ever imagine. I had a reservation for 5.40 pm flight to Atlanta on Aug 17 that was delayed by 3 hours - reason given was “late inbound crew “.After 3 hours of waiting, the flight was announced cancelled now the reason given was bad weather. The weather was fantastic here and in Atlanta from 5pm -9pm. So I don’t get it. I was going for an important medical two day training course which was starting Aug 18 at 8am to 5.30 pm . So I had to get there in time. They were able to pt me on the next flight which was supposed to depart at 9.36pm but after waiting on plane for 3 hours that was announced as cancelled too due to the thunderstorm. Funny part is we waited on flight for close to 4 hours and the storm now had passed but they could not fly as crew had timed out! I luckily hD no checked in baggage but the folks who did were asked to come back next day at 6 am to pick it up. They were not ready to give out baggage to passengers for whom flying the next day was not an option... again because their crew had gone home. It almost felt like their crew had to rush home once the clock struck a certain hour otherwise they would turn into pumpkins like in the Cinderella story! Then one of their crew members has the audacity to talk to all the stranded passengers badly - He tells us , "this happens.  Crew has gone home, we are humans not machines, we need to go home too! We can’t give you bags today. Come back at 6 am" Just unacceptable! I will never fly United again - if you are fond of being mistreated and insulted, this is the airline for you!

|  Chicago to Cleveland. The worst flight experience I’ve ever had. This summer alone I’ve flown on three separate airlines. I have never lost a bag or had a bag put on the wrong flight until I flew this airline. Not only do they over charge for checked bags they mishandle them and treat you like it’s not their fault. I’ve always been weary of this airline because of their tendency to have their name in the news for negative reasons. This flight has been a prime example of why I will avoid United Airlines for the rest of my life. From Punta Cana to ORD there was hardly any service and they took thirty minutes to get us off the plane. We had a two hour layover in ORD which should have given us plenty of time to get our bags, go through customs, recheck our bag, go through security, and get something to eat before our next flight; of course with United that wasn’t the case. They took 30 minutes to get us off the plane (again), they took twice that to get our bags off of the flight, and they finally lost one of our bags and put it on another flight. Let’s just hope that the baggage check attendant (the only positive part and person from this terrible experience) is correct in saying it will be delivered by today or tomorrow.

|  Denver to Philadelphia. A 6 hour delay was the absolute worst experience of my entire life I have never been so  uncomfortable, and tired in my whole life. Every step of the process was delayed. We left late. Had to stop at a different airport for gas. And now we’re sitting here waiting for a ground crew.

|  Redmond to Los Angeles. This is the worst flight experience I have had in a long time, luckily I have plenty of time waiting in the airport to write reviews. It started at the check in counter where I was informed that my economy ticket only allowed one bag under the seat, no use of the overhead bin, therefore I had to check my one carry on bag for $25. At the gate they announced that a different flight (to San Fran) was delayed 3.5 hours because they had to fly in a part for the plane from Portland. 15 minutes later they come up with a solution, the airline chose to take the plane from my flight and use it for the San Fran rout instead. Now my wife and I get to wait an extra 3.5 hours instead! My wife has to go back out of security to talk to someone from the airline, who tells her no there aren't any more flights and no we won't be compensated for the inconvenience of missing the party we are flying to LA for. Now I'm at the only airport bar where the credit card reader is broken, so no food/drinks while we wait. This sucks, we are definitely flying Alaska next time. Flight UA5644

|  A horrible airline. Third week in a row flying from Chicago to Dallas on the 5am flight for business. And each week United has had “unplanned maintenance” or “schedule disruptions” with all flights being delayed 2+ hours. Get your act together United. Have flown with 5+ airlines and United is by far the worst one.

|  It's been a terrible experience so far with United and Middle East Airlines getting my luggage back! Flying back home to Lebanon after a great vacation with my family in the US ended up with a chaotic return. Arriving to Beirut airport, none of my bags made it to the belt as we waited for our 5 bags. After constantly chasing United and MEA for our luggage we got 1 bag out of 5, 2 days after our arrival. A couple of days later we got another 3. It's been 10 days now and I am still missing 1 bag! Yet the biggest issue is the fact that United and MEA still cannot locate my bag! I don't understand how an established airline like United can make such a careless error! I can't express how disappointed I am that a Star Alliance airline cannot manage the basic customer service request of finding my bag. I am not sure what kind of compensation they plan on giving me at this point.

|  Los Angeles  to Honolulu. This wasn't the best flight I've taken. The seats were very uncomfortable and felt super hard leather. There was no exact entertainment system so instead you had to put your phone or ipad inside the holder which I didn't have with me. They didn't have that much stuff for breakfast. The United Wi-Fi was super expensive : $11 for 1 hour, $15 for 2 hours, $21 for full flight. They only offered one website free which was unitedwifi.com where for free you could stream a limited number of movies for free without being able to access the rest of the internet. I didn't have headphones so that didn't work out.

|  This flight was a "United by SkyWest" Flight From Boise, Idaho to San Francisco and then to Fresno California. The gate operations and boarding went fine in Boise, and we departed on time. The problem started in San Francisco (SFO). When arriving in SFO, the pilot came on the intercom, alerting us to a computer problem "Only effecting Skywest flights" and that the plane couldn't, leave the gate since without the computer they couldn't do anything, but don't worry we would have it all cleared up in 20 minutes. 1 hour and 40 minutes later, they started to taxi around the tarmac in an effort to look like we were getting somewhere. At 2 hours we did finally get into the gate. We were told that most outbound flights were delayed so, Hurry and get to your gate and you can probably still get your connection. I rushed, I made it onto the plane. After about 20 minutes I noticed that we were not moving. Within a few minutes the flight crew arrives. The pilot announces that since they had been stuck on the Tarmac just like the rest of us, that they were about to "Time Out:" and that they were waiting for another flight crew to come aboard so that they could take over in Fresno. A few minutes later they announce that "The Flight crew has arrived and they are waiting on the Jetway for paperwork." Another hour passes, and still no flight crew. At exactly 2 hours after closing the plane they open it again, this time to announce that since they don't have seats for the new flight crew (There was 2 Deadhead crew already on the plane) that they would have to trade out the flight crew now. (Why it took them 2 hours to make this decision I don't know) At this time a New Voice comes over the intercom announcing that "If You are going to get off Plane do so Now." No explanation just a threatening voice, with no offer to re-book on another plane. Around 15 minutes later the captain (1st Crew) walks back into the cabin to explain what was going on and says that the new crew would be on the plane in a few minutes. Around 20 minutes later the new crew does arrive, and the Captain announces that as soon as they completed the inspection, and they had completed paper work we would be leaving, "It should be about 20 minutes". We all had a good laugh. I have never heard passengers catcall the pilot before. Well after another hour (The flight is now 4.5 hours late in departure) they push us back from the gate and start the plane. We eventually take off and arrive in Fresno 5 hours late.
Route: Boise to Fresno via San Francisco

FullReview: |  Houston to Saint Louis. No notification of delays. Delays for over 2 hrs. Zero customer service. Never will use again. Cheapest and poorest run airline I have ever flown. I wish I could change but not even given an option.

|  United lost my luggage on my flight from Los Angeles to San Francisco. Upon arrival at SFO they told us they have found the luggage at LAX and that they will deliver it in the evening since they have a flight every hour. After we went to our house we checked with the automated messaging system and that we get a message saying that it is out for delivery. We were waiting for the whole night since it had very important item in it but with no avail. Finally we contacted the agents but they did not have any communication with their drivers to tell us the ETA. On our earlier flight from SFO to LAX they lost 9 out of 10 luggage. We received those luggages three days later at our vacation destination. We had to endure those three important vacation days without required medication and daily requirement needs in our vacation. Of course no compensation for all those pain and inconvenience at all. In my view United is in-efficient with bad management to cause me this kind of inconvenience and pain for being it's customer. I would not recommend it for anyone unless this is the only airline that is left in the world.

|  Cancun to Montreal via Dulles. I am a frequent traveler, first and last time with United. Our flights from Montréal to Dulles and from Dulles to Cancun were OK, no more no less, had to pay for anything more than drinks. Staff wasn't particularly nice, nor rude, just doing their job. The way back, though. Another story. The flight from Cancun to Dulles was juste a few minutes late, no big deal. Pilot put the pedal to the metal and we were actually there in advance. Then our flight to Montreal was delayed. By 30 min, then 1 hour, then 2 hours, 2 and a half... Next thing we know, it is past midnight and our flight is cancelled. We waited at the ticket counter for 20 min to be transfered on another flight, only to finally have them tell us that they're re-switching us back on the same flight that they decided last minute to postpone to the following morning. Caused all kinds of problems at check-in after we spent the night at the airport hotel, since they gave the flight a different number. Needless to say the plane was 20 min late the following day. Never flying United again. Lost 8 hours of work because of their disorganization.

|  Los Angeles to Medford. Flight on time, but this aircraft is incredibly cramped, even in their so-called Economy Plus. In fact, I don't think it was any roomier than any of the other seats. The interior of the aircraft itself was tattered and worn. The flight attendant was very nice and professional, but her appearance could have been a bit more polished. I realize this is 2018 and working as a flight attendant isn't a beauty contest, but certainly there's a professional and corporate image to uphold, even at United.

|  Newark to Richmond. Just another classic landing without my luggage. Same as when i flew to Detroit, Chicago, etc. These clowns just cannot figure this not. Horrible horrible management. Never flying with United airlines  again.

|  Dublin to Raleigh via Newark. I have never left a review for an airline in 30 years of travel (first time for everything). Our flight experience yesterday was pretty bad, and after dealing with the customer service today, I feel the need to write this. First, dropping our checked bags at the Dublin airport took 50 minutes which I find ridiculous (thank goodness we arrived 3 hours early). The staff wasn't exactly efficient or in a hurry. Second, our flight was delayed 45 minutes to Newark. That's fine, delays happen, but when I tried asking a flight attendant if we were in jeopardy of missing our connection, it took 30 minutes for me to even flag someone down on the flight (even though my call light was on the whole time), and she was extremely rude and short. The flight attendants in general were less than friendly, especially when I asked if they had snacks for purchase and the attendant looked at me like I was dumb and said no. Got it. We finally arrive to our final destination in Raleigh and our bags did not arrive with us. We were informed they'd be on the next flight, but since we live three hours away, they said they would have them flown to Columbia, SC and would arrive Saturday night around 11pm, and then would be delivered to us.  No big deal again, we get these things happen. Well, here we are Sunday at 10:00am, and the bags are nowhere to be found.  It took me 30+ minutes to speak with someone in customer service and the language barrier is so bad, that I still don't know when our bags will arrive or why they didn't make the flight to Columbia last night. It’s not the poor man’s fault, sometimes it’s just too difficult for both parties. I asked to speak to a supervisor but was told he was busy and would call me back (doubtful). I also called back and asked if I could speak with someone whose native language was English to avoid the language barrier and frustration (two attempts failed). They finally told me calls are globally routed and I'd have to keep calling until a native English speaker answered (30 min wait time each call). This goes far beyond things out of United’s control happening, and today finally made me realize it’s just terrible customer service.  I am done making excuses for United and the people I have dealt with during my travels.  No desire to travel on this airline again. I’m flustered so I’m sure there are typos. Great trip where I got engaged and ended on a bad note. Now we need to buy a bunch of items just so we can go to work tomorrow morning.

| United must be trying to coerce Basic Economy buyers to upgrade by treating you like complete garbage. One of their rude staff members even told us our experience was the way it was (very very terrible) because we bought Basic Economy tickets. The staff from the DIA ticket counter to the gate were all unprofessional and rude. Our worst flight experience ever, and we've had many flights, was on this flight. This was the first time we bought a Basic Economy ticket, although unknowingly through a popular online reseller. So to start, we found out you only get one personal item and no small carry-on. Usually we have our small carry-on and personal item, which fit just fine under the seat with room to spare for our feet. Second, there is no online check-in, you will waste your time trying like I did. Third, when you go to the airport, numerous United signs tell you to use a kiosk to check in. That doesn't work either, as the kiosk instructs you to go to a ticketing agent to waste time. You have to look for a tiny little section off to the left that reads "Economy", where it is manned by a single representative. Fourth, once we got to the rude Economy ticketing agent, he pretended to not know why the kiosk rejected us so we had to show him. He quickly reminded us that we have the junk "Basic Economy" tickets. Then, we tried to hand our checked/labeled baggage to said rude agent since he had a scale one feet to his left, and he points to the other longer line and says "it goes over there". On to the bag line, the lady there was no better. She tells my wife in a rude tone (while also talking angrily to her coworkers), "License and boarding pass!" No "hello", no "how are you", not even a complete sentence, and they weren't even very busy so it surely couldn't have been that she was rushing or stressed out. After a very long security line wait with ultra slow TSA workers, we finally got to the gate and the door had just shut. This part was only partially United's fault due to lack of online check-in and their deceiving kiosk signs which wasted a good 30 minutes of precious time. The United gate agent was completely unprofessional and bitter and lacked any sympathy whatsoever. She kept telling me, in very stern fashion, to check my ticket next time as if I were new to flying. With a reluctant look on her face and body language, she got us onto a later flight. We lost our purchased seats, and my 8 year old was assigned a seat away from our group next to complete strangers. To conclude, making United staff do any extra work is a crime so steer clear of United Airlines.

|  Toronto to San Juan via Newark. This airline has very poor practices, and bad customer service. Our flight between Newark and San Juan my parents and I had paid extra ($75USD each) to pick our seats by getting economy plus. Upon checking in online, we discovered that they gave up our seats, and now we no longer had seats. We then called to get our seats back. This did not happen. They instead gave us seats close to each other. Okay fine... BUT when arriving to the airport we go to print our boarding passes and again discover that we DO NOT have seats! So we have been told on the phone to settle things at the Toronto airport, then we were told to settle things at the Newark airport, and finally we were told that they can’t do anything. Why did we spend about $250USD just to get shuffled around? Stop charging people for services that you are not providing. That is a scam, plain and simple. You said that it happens when aircrafts shift, but that’s your problem. I paid for this service and expect to get seats without the hassle that we have been through.
Route: Toronto to San Juan via Newark

FullReview: | Flew United Airlines from Newark to Tampa. The worst experience with an airline I’ve ever had. They do not allow disabled people to board first, nor if you have a child over 2. The seats have arm holders that do not lift up so with a small child who is scared or a person who is larger and needs more space, it’s not an option. You have to pay for carry-ons and pay to pick your seat, in addition to your ticket. So awful. One agent even threatened to refuse a woman on the plan for the size of her purse. As a disabled woman traveling with a child, I’m extremely dissatisfied. There were several great agents before we got to our gate which is the only reason this rating is not 0.

|  Flight delayed from Denver to Helena 2 times! From the time I left to go to the airport in Colorado Springs and fly with United to Helena I could have driven in almost the same amount of time. When I politely ask the employee at the gate desk when the flight to Helena left, he was very short and rude.

|  Columbia to Tokyo via Denver. I checked into my flight 1 hour prior to takeoff as I had multiple connecting flights, first one was domestic to Colorado. The airport is a small local regional airport that decided to schedule 3 flights within a 20 min period with 1 line of TSA agents checking people in. Needless to say, United airlines left 20+ passengers behind on a flight with 50 seats total. American Airlines also had 2 flights taking off within this period but delayed the flights to ensure that all their passengers made it onto their flights. My checked bag also left without me, and will be sitting unattended in Okinawa for at least 24 hours while I’m stuck here in the United States. Needless to say, I will never fly United Airlines again even if they offered free flights.

|  Not only was my flight delayed and I wasn’t notified, but then when I got on the plane in Portland bound for Chicago, they told me I would need to gate check my bag and pick it up at my final destination in Omaha. So now I am spending an extra 6 hours in Chicago and when I finally get to Omaha at nearly 11 PM ( originally scheduled to land at 5:09 PM), I need to go to baggage claim. Not happy and I will avoid flying United in the future at all costs!

|  Denver to Columbus. Nickeled and dimed, even for a carry-on. Customer support wasn't even interested in hearing it - they just kept spouting that if I had purchased through their site rather than Expedia, then I would have known better. Apparently half their flights don't even include one single carry-on. How on earth is someone supposed to bring clothing??

|  Dallas Ft Worth to Denver. The rudest crew and unfriendliest flying experience. I get it, that was an early flight. Eat some chocolate and chug a coffee, no need to be mean or rude when I or any of my other surrounding passengers didn’t do anything to deserve it. Especially when I’m tired and stressed, but still manage every please, thank you, ma’ams and sirs while smiling like I’m a morning person (which I’m not!). If you don’t want to work don’t be here

|  Newark to Phoenix. This was the worst airline I’ve ever flown. My husband and I were not seated together I was in row 28 and he was in row 38 with 2 gentlemen of about 7 ft tall. They were father and son basketball players the son with ASU. My husband was bruised on his foot by the lack of room in the seats. The bathrooms were locked for the first hour while the inept crew attended a woman with a seizure probably due to the excessive heat in the cabin. Another woman threw up and there was no cart service for the first half of the trip. When I spoke to the crew about the heat that was so bad most people were spillled over into the aisle as the seats were suffocating. I was told to turn on my air vent which was fully open. Duh! We were instructed to only use the bathroom in our assigned cabin, once they were finally open. The access to the bathroom was obstructed by the stretched out legs of the 7 ft man who should never been moved to the last row where the seat room is mallet due to airline design and lack of reclining seats although the row in front reclines into thenpassengers face

| Washington to Panama. Most horrible airline i’ve ever flown with. 20 minutes of storm means 12 hours of delay. They kept postponing the boarding time so you keep counting the hours down but then they keep adding them up. The resources or explanations are not given to any of the passengers, so we just get told to ‘sit down and relax’ like sitting ducks. While we are all here missing our next transit flights, but they couldnt care less.

|  Flew Los Angeles to Milan via Newark. What a horrible experience with United Airlines. This so called company is great at taking your money but if there is one bit of an issue, then you have to speak with a supposed customer service that is in the Philippines and all they do is say "sorry, so sorry you have a bad opinion of us". We've been stuck without any clothes or hotel and they basically wash their hands and blame it on the airlines. I used them once before and spent over $15K with them and more of the same. It was my mistake to comeback for a second round of abuse with this so called company.
Route: Los Angeles to Milan via Newark

FullReview: | Our flight was delayed, then we boarded. After numerous announcements we would be leaving we were asked to reboard. Twice a flight attendant was rude, cart with water and snacks pushed away from me. We were offered a meal voucher which we never got because they took so long to distribute them and when I got close was told we were boarding. After everyone was seated and thought we were finally leaving we were told the plane needed 20 minutes to fuel. An hour later we were told there was another delay because commissary hadn't delivered yet. At that point passengers raised objections to the delay while flight attendants laughed at us. My wife and I were stunned at how unprofessional they handled the situation. We arrived 5.5 hours late in Houston.

| Flew roundtrip Chattanooga to Portland, ME I have not flown for several years, so prepared for challenges. Well, kudos to TSA recheck. Made security one big breeze. The plane in both directions were very small and had no overheads to accommodate the regulation size carryons which was included in my fare. Flying Economy Plus? Not sure, they have so many different levels depending on what a la cartes you picked! First the ticket agent in Chattanooga made me check my carry on and pay  $25. When got to gate the same agent gave everyone in boarding area baggage tags to check them for free on the jetway! Did file complaint with United and they have responded to my issue with a refund, so one plus for them. But, the agent, hopefully, will be reprimanded. It was dishonest to charge me and I did not realize till I boarded plane. Return flight, we got in early. They did not have bags in jetway as we deplaned! Instead, we waited 45 minutes after 11 PM for bags to enter carousel in baggage claim. Very exhausting that time of night. Why did they not make it convenient for us to grab as we got off plane? Overall, flying pinched inside a tiny seat with little leg room was awful. the plane was 57 degrees on return flight and stewardess said they were working on -  did finally begin to warm after 2 hours, just before landing. Did not partake of the free drinks and pretzels, so can't speak to snacks, seem crazy in short legs of flight. Would not look forward to flying again and booking online. Too many options you can pick from that just keep adding up and seem annoyingly presented on entire page to get you to spend more. Used to fly a lot, and will not miss it if never go again.

| United's flight from Denver, 1.5 hours late. Missed airport pickup, had to pay for another ride $28. Pilot said we were waiting for mechanics to come to tighten some bolts (I do not know if he was speaking seriously). Food on board not as described on menu: hamburger had no lettuce, tomatoes, or pickles as promised. As small as it was and served bare it was just like a 99c white castle hamburger. Seats comfortable and cabin crew kind and gentle. Agent at PSP kept trying to get money from me: first he claimed I'd have to remove 3 lbs b/c suitcase was 73 lbs. He had another bag on the scale. After removing it he said I was 1lb over and I said that 23 kilos is 51 lbs. He didn't care. Then insisted I pay $25 to check a suitcase even though was making an international connexion to one of their partners, but the swarthy 20-year old doesn't know what qualifies as a connexion. I couldn't convince him or his supervisor and they refused to call a ticketing expert. I was firm and insistent but because this supervisor told me I was rude (limited vocabulary), I paid the fine. I am constantly baffled that people who hate coming into contact with the public and who have no talent for customer service seem to be hired by United again and again.
ReviewTitle: "kept trying to get money from me"

FullReview: | Our group was returning to the US after two weeks of international travel. At the United terminal we endured an overbooked check-in with rude ground agents. Some of our group waited for seat assignments until the plane was almost fully loaded despite the tickets being purchased a year in advance. The inflight service was just as rude as what we experienced in the terminal. Air New Zealand (the service we used in Australia and New Zealand) by comparison was staffed with a pleasant, polite and accommodating in flight crew. United needs to revisit customer service training of their entire staff. Improvement is sorely needed. Very disappointed and dissatisfied!

|  Norfolk to San Diego. Worst experience I've ever had flying. Every gate they told me to go to was wrong. I had no forewarning over the PA or on the website, flight gets delayed. These people have no care for your time and provide no real service or anything they just want your money. I'm never flying with United again. I've never had an experience this displeasing flying across the country.

| Palm Springs to New York via San Francisco. You always know discourtesy is coming when the airport clerks refuse to wear their name plates. Charged me $25 for suitcase even though am making an international connexion. Agents don't know LGA and JFK are "co-terminals" in NYC and that an Intl connexion in North America is 12 hours. Although I was the only customer there they refused to call their international desk but instead called me "rude" because I was firm. I just paid the fine because I know the next step after they call you rude is to call a SWAT team to arrest you. This is usual customer service in 2018. They just want money and they want a lot of it.
Route: Palm Springs to New York via San Francisco

FullReview: |  First time flying with United and last time. Horrible experience our flight was canceled just when we were on the plane ready to leave, not delayed, canceled! They kept giving us the runaround, they aggravate the customer even more with their senseless behavior. I don't recommend United.

|  Terrible customer service. My wife missed her connecting flight because of a delayed flight and had to sleep at the airport because United would not get her a hotel. Not only that, but they did not offer anything else for the inconvenience. Will never being flying United again. They do not take care of their customers at all!

|  Newark to San Antonio. Worst airline ever, 3 hours delayed and still sitting. Pilot and staff have no idea when it is going to be on air. I frankly don’t know how it is in business with such low ratings.

|  Traverse City to Newark. This is the worst airline I have ever flown. Every time I have flown United there has been delays. The weather is perfect both in my departing city and arriving city. There are no mechanical problems with the plane, but now we are sitting in the runway delayed for 1 hour. They give no explanation for the delay and no compensation Is provided. I am on a very small plane with only 3 seats in a row and no room for overhead storage. This airline should be ashamed.

| Las Vegas to Chicago via Los Angeles. On a business trip. Aircraft were relatively old and nothing special about the crew or the flights. The problem occurred when was flying from ORD to NYC LaGuardia LGA flight was supposed to leave at 5pm suddenly flight got cancelled without further information except due to weather conditions. The 4pm flight is going ahead and the 6pm flight as well. To my surprise the 3pm, 5pm and 7pm flights are cancelled to NYC however the 4pm, 6pm and 8pm flights are normal operation. Then the chaos started tried to rebook myself on a standby for the 6pm flight didn’t work out checked with the United staff and they are probably deaf or not listening or helping not knowing where my luggage are or how to locate them or where to go. No one from the ground staff is helping and all they say it’s due to weather we can’t help you and there’s no further flights to NYC till tomorrow afternoon while I have to attend an important meeting at 8:30AM. This situation was just a joke. Eventually located my luggage which already been sent to LGA on the 6pm flight which I don’t understand how would they send luggage without the passenger being on board the flight and had to queue with my colleague for almost 2 hours to rebook ourselves. When we reached the counter the only option the clerk gave us was to rebook to Hartford which is 2 hrs away from NYC we had to accept that and sort ourselves from Hartford then that particular flight got delayed which makes it arrive in Hartford at 3am which impossible for us to find our way to NYC. Eventually we booked ourselves on a different airline and paid 500 USD each for a one way ticket from Chicago to New York City. Seriously the most unorganised airline in the world. Later on we discovered that they had a system failure and that’s why they couldn’t operate certain flights but to avoid compensating passengers or booking hotels for them they delcraed it’s due to weather. Will never fly with this airline ever again. It’s the first and last experience with them.
Route: Las Vegas to Chicago via Los Angeles

FullReview: |  Houston to Frankfurt. Seats are much too narrow - you’ve got to hug yourself in order to leave your neighbor alone. My girlfriends entertainment system kept crashing. Everything seemed to be outdated and a bit dirty. Legroom in Premium economy was alright, but no space for the shoulders - it almost felt like a livestock transport. Service was nice, but I will avoid United in the future.

|  Las Vegas to Greenville. Never notified that flight was cancelled until checking bags. I didn’t get home until next day, had to sleep in airport, lost wages from job because returned a day late. I didn’t get a sorry, or a comp or anything I was thousands a miles away from my kids in Las Vegas scared and very bad experience for a first time flyer. I had a horrible experience and I have called and emailed headquarters and top officials and no reply or call back. Very unprofessional, very bad and unpleasant experience.

|  After a recent business trip to Tucson, my coworker and I received the worst customer service from not one, but two United representatives. We arrived at the Tucson airport about an hour and a half early and while we were heading to our gate we received a push notification that the flight was delayed so we went and grabbed food, and set up at a charging station a few gates down. When it was getting close to the time that we would need to start boarding, we walked over to the gate and found out that the flight left at its scheduled time. No updates, no announcement for boarding, nothing. The woman at the gate laughed it off saying that when the pilot wants to leave the pilot leaves. With no more flights leaving from Tucson that day on United, we were infuriated. The woman was not empathetic, wouldn’t look us in the eyes, and gave us no other options but to stay in Tucson (not comped by United, mind you) and arrive to Cleveland at 3pm the next day. We called the customer service line and the representative literally said “I don’t understand why you weren’t at your gate, you should have been there”. After he also unempathetically didn’t even try to help us, I asked to speak to a manager. I’m pretty sure I spoke to the same guy who just changed his voice into a higher pitched tone. He said the same and wouldn’t even give me a refund, gave me a hard time about missing the flight and said that he knows that they make courtesy announcements before taking off. Apparently you don’t, or I wouldn’t have been stranded in Tucson. After finally calling again and speaking to a much nicer woman, we were able to get a partial refund and bought tickets on American Airlines flying just a few hours later. I’ve never had such a poor customer service experience in my life and will never fly with United again unless absolutely necessary. Taking my business elsewhere!

|  Absolutely terrible service and we will never be flying with you guys ever again. We called the night before to make sure everything was okay with the flight and it was. However, when we get to the airport which is 2 hours away from where we live we get a call once we are at the airport that the flight was cancelled. So, we think that we will just be getting on another flight so we will still be able to get to our destination that day. We stood in line to check in for about 35 minutes and then the person there, after failing to put in our confrontation code 3 times, told us that our flight has been rescheduled for tomorrow and that we might not even be able to get on that flight. I’m really disappointed in United Airlines in their lack of communication. We weren’t even told why the flight was canceled. They wasted our time and lost our business. Not that they truly care but my mother’s family who were suppose to pick her up took the day off work and my mother, who hasn’t seen her family for many years now, is forced to go back home and wait because United Airlines can’t get their priority’s straight. Your customers should be your main priority and clearly they aren’t.

|  MBS Airport to Reno. Will never fly with United again. There were multiple maintenance issues - 2 on one layover at Denver, and 1 in chicago. The Chicago flight we ended up turning around due to hydraulics issues which caused us to miss our connecting flight. There were no agents at the gate to help us find a new flight so we had to call. The first time we called they hung up on us. All in all we were almost 7 hours late to our destination. I'm guessing they aren't using great planes if they had that many issues and awful customer service. Will not recommend to anyone.

|  Chicago to Phoenix. Due to a mechanical issue the airplane was delayed and we sat on the plane for 30-45 minutes. While I would have preferred an ontime arrival, delays can happen. The crew was very professional and served snacks and water and informed us continuously and the doors were reopened just in case somebody wanted to leave the aircraft. United proactively rebooked me on a later flight just in case the issue would not have been fixed. In the end we did depart with a delay. The rest of the flight was uneventful. I was flying Economy Plus and the seat was comfortable and offered enough legspace. United Economy Plus is the same seat and same onboard service as it is in regular Economy but with some inches of more legspace. I just flew with a different us carrier in the Premium Economy Class/Comfort Plus class and they also offer a free alcoholic drink and a premium snack in the Economy Plus section. United should do the same thing and upgrade the Economy Plus section.

|  Absolutely horrible, will not be flying United again even if I have to pay more. Terrible customer service. My plane way delayed for 5 hours because they were waiting for another plane to arrive. This caused many of us to miss our connecting flights, and minimal information was given. They did nothing to make this situation better for their customers. No company should be able to treat paying customers like this.

|  Denver to Albuquerque. From now on I will always pay more to avoid this airline. I’ve flown twice in the last month with United and both times were absolute terrible experiences. Long delays with minimal information provided as to why. You can’t bring a carry on if you’re flying basic economy class but they don’t have a good system for keeping track of baggage apparently because they managed to lose mine on a 45 minute direct flight. Pay extra to fly a different airline because this is trash.

|  I’m a small business owner, and if I treated my customers the way United Airlines treats their customers I would be out of business. I spent $2800 to fly my family to Turks and Caicos from Denver. United Airlines changed the aircraft and even though I booked our flights over a year ago, they separated our family all throughout the aircraft. Our children had to enter the aircraft on the back and we had to enter the aircraft on the front. This was on our way back home. When we connected through Houston I noticed that my luggage was damaged. So I have a three hour layover in Houston and I figured I would go and talk to baggage services, as I did not want to handle it when I arrive in Denver at 11:30 at night. I mean why not handle it at a normal time of day when I have three hours to kill, but the person working the United baggage service tells me she can’t do a claim for me and it must be done at my final destination. When I asked why couldn’t it just be handled right now she said that is United Airlines policy. I’m sorry, but when your policy causes agitation to a customer, and you have no explanation besides it’s your policy then that is something that should be changed. I found it comical that United airlines employee tells me that I need to post on social media about how negative my experience was. I doubt that will do any good. When I asked why couldn’t it just be handled right now she said that is United Airlines policy. I’m sorry, but when your policy causes agitation to a customer, and you have no explanation besides it’s your policy then that is something that should be changed. I found it comical that United airlines employee tells me that I need to post on social media about how negative my experience was. I doubt that will do any good. Amazing that a company could be this big and provide such terrible service. If I could give them zero stars I would, I will not use United Airlines if I have a choice.

Houston to St. Louis. I never leave negative reviews. I typically do not think it is worthwhile. However, the treatment I received today was so incredibly rude I feel I need to share my experience. The woman working the front desk treated my husband and I with such disdain I honestly thought she was joking at first. The flight was uncomfortable, but that's to be somewhat expected in economy, so that part I was not as bothered by. Seriously, train your staff better. Literally every flight attendant, as well as the women at the front counter before boarding, were rude and just generally unpleased. Towards all passengers.

|  Los Angeles to Arcata via San Francisco. Absolutely the worst organization I've ever experienced, and I've been flying since I was 3 months old (24+ yrs). Every trip in the past 2 years has either been delayed or cancelled there's no point in even making a reservation because we end up renting a car and driving 8 hours anyway with little to no compensation for the flight. Have had multiple bags lost or 'misplaced'. I don't know how they can even keep business. Imagine if this was a 400$ hotel room and you get there to find your room isn't ready for 6 hours and they over booked so you have to stay in a budget hotel anyways, just ridiculous; meanwhile the executives are taking home million $ bonuses chartering private planes cause they don't even want to fly on their own airline. I feel bad for the employees who have to deal with all the customer service bs while they are just trying to do their job. The only positive thing I have to say is that the employees do try and are nice a majority of the time so please don't make it hard on them.
Route: Los Angeles to Arcata via San Francisco

FullReview: |  Shannon to Newark. Worst airline experience I’ve ever had. Flight was delayed because of mechanical problems and we were stuck for an hour and a half extra on the plane before departure. Then another hour after landing waiting on a gate on the other side of the airport and most everyone missed their connecting flights. Our connecting flight was then delayed again another hour and when we finally  arrived, we were stuck in a foreign country without our luggage because it “didn’t make our flight”. We had to call multiple times to get our luggage delivered. Will not fly again.

|  Worst flight experience I’ve ever had. When I got to the airport to drop off my bag (after self check in) it took 25 minutes for them to put a sticker on my bag and put it on the belt and I was the first one in line. There were only 3 people working and very long lines and wait times. When I got to the gate to fly out I heard that I would miss my connecting flight I went to talk to gate agents to see what my options are. They were not very helpful the only thing they did was rebook my on a flight for the morning and told me I’d have to figure out my plans once I was in Houston. They were condescending and blaming everything on policy. When I got to Houston, the customer service agents there were very helpful in getting me a room and other accommodations. But when I went to receive my checked bag for the night in the hotel, I was told that I was unable to get the bag and couldn’t have access to it til tomorrow. United is the worst airline I have flown, regarding everything from check in to reliability. At the Nashville airport there were 9 total delayed flights and 8 of them were United. I’ve also heard from several other guests that this is a common occurrence and had happened to them earlier this week. United needs some serious change in their operations as well as retraining employees.

|  I booked my flight along with my husbands flight 9 months in advance. The day before my flight I discovered I was only getting one boarding pass. My husbands flight booking was under a different conf #. This would be fine however the united miles plus card no longer applies to him, therefore he looses priority boarding AND United took it upon them selves to change our seating assignments to where we were no longer seated next to each other for 14 hr flights. I have never had my seating changed by any airline after choosing a seating assignment if they "cant be guaranteed" there is no advantage flying United over Southwest aside from paying more money. They had availability to accommodate to economy plus but of course wanted more money. we had to change flights adding a 4 hour layover and pickup arrangements just to sit next to each other. No wonder United ranks so poorly in customer service. I will avoid flying this airline at all costs in the future, its more important to try and suck another $300 out of a customer than accommodate and make it right. I will also be canceling my United Plus card as it serves no benefits. It does us no good to travel together if only one person on the card gets priority. I was on the phone for over an hour and 30 min with costumer service that is a joke. My time is money but obviously United does not care about that.

|  Chicago to Birmingham. Every time I fly with United it is an awful experience. They have the most rude, arrogant, and unhelpful agents at the gate and on the plane. If you want a pleasant experience avoid United.

|  My parents and I were travelling from Frankfurt to San Francisco with United Airlines. United has a dedicated check-in area in Frankfurt, with dedicated counters for premium cabins and frequent travellers. The check-in is operated by trained Lufthansa agents and was quick, friendly and easy. Thanks to our UA status we were allowed into the Lufthansa Senator lounge at Frankfurt airport and enjoyed our pre-boarding snack and drinks. I love United´s unique and efficient boarding process. We were seated in the Economy Plus section and had plenty of legspace. The food in Economy is okay, snacks were served throughout the flight and wine and beer is available in all travel classes for free. The staff was very nice and the flight was enjoyable. Good selection of movies, internet and power outlets are available. Condition of the airplane very good (well, the B747 is retired now and it’s the new 777). Overall a very pleasant flight with on-time arrival in San Francisco.

|  Las Vegas to Newark. So they waited until 30 minutes before boarding to tell us about a 3 hour delay. After this delay, they let us board. After letting everyone get boarded and situated, they announce another hour delay. Instead of waiting another hour to board, they packed us in like sardines and continued to delay the plane. I understand delays are our of their control, but tell us as you find out. Dont trick us into being stuck on the flight. Nothing was added for a 5 hour delay, 2 of which were spent on the plane, sitting still at the gate. We paid for a flight that leaves at 11:15am. So, if you can't accommodate me, let me know. Don't drag me along. Get better at organizing flights before you have a whole company that screws over thousands of people. Never flying United again.

|  Los Cabos to Portland via San Francisco. Absolutely terrible service. The employees in Mexico spoke better English then all but one person I encountered in San Francisco. Was told the incorrect gate multiple times causing my pregnant wife to have to trek from one end of the terminal to the other. Smallest amount of legroom yet and the leather seats are awful.
Route: Los Cabos to Portland via San Francisco

FullReview: |  This has been the most inconvienent experience I have been through. The customer service was extremely difficult and did not provide any help whatsoever. I was sent back and forth across the airport to talk to different people and every worker I encountered was horrendously rude and inconsiderate to my situation. My original flight had been cancelled and I was informed that I may not be able to catch another flight for three days and that they would not be providing a hotel. I retrieved a ride and made it to my destination (13 hours later than I was supposed to be there) and proceeded to follow up with phone calls to ask where my baggage might be since the workers at the airport did not answer any of my questions. The people I spoke with on the phone were just as rude and inconsiderate as the other United Airlines workers I had previously spoke with. I will not be flying with them again. (I also did not get my money back and I purchesed traveler’s insurance).

| An incredibly disappointing experience on United. Traveling to the Bay Area for a conference, I booked this flight on a 777-200, thinking it might be kind of fun to fly on a domestic widebody and that the cramped 3-4-3 configuration would be fine. How wrong I was. There was a half-hour delay prior to departure — annoying, but not a big deal. Once on board, however, I noticed that the TVs had been removed and replaced with personal device entertainment holders. However, we were informed that the Wi-Fi did not work and, as such, we wouldn't be able to use the Personal Device Entertainment. A six hour flight with no TVs or Wi-Fi. Unbelievable. Throughout my whole experience, the crew was incredibly rude and inattentive. Upon landing at SFO, we waited on the taxiway for 50+ minutes since (as the captain told it) United operations had screwed up and didn't have a gate for us. There were a number of passengers connecting on to other destinations, many of which there is only one flight a day to from SFO. All told, we arrived at the gate around 1.5 hours late. Combined with our delay leaving BOS, many of my fellow passengers missed their connections and had to be put up overnight. My experience on the return flight was slightly better — the Wi-Fi/personal device entertainment worked and the crew was more courteous — but the damage had been done. If I have any choice, I'll never fly with United Airlines again.

|  Delhi to Newark. Worst customer service. This is my second trip from India back and forth to America in 2 months due to unforeseen circumstances. First I thought that few of the crew members were rude. Now since I have flown so much in 2 months and I have not met one nice united crew members.
|  Washington to Paris. The Boeing 787 was the best part of this trip. It was comfortable and fresh. Service was good with on time departure and arrival. I thought food served was scarce though.

|  Miami to Las Vegas via Houston. Worst customer service ever and made me and my sons experience horrible. I missed my boarding time by 5mins even though my friend was on the phone with me while I was running to the gate because they told her to call me and tell me to hurry. So she got on the plane since they told her to and once she was on they told her they canceled me and my sons flight. The ramp was still connected to the plane when I was trying to get on and my friend said they hadn't even shut the plane door yet and on top of that when I looked at the flight after they took off the flight status was “early departure”. There was no reason to not let me on the plane and and the lady I was speaking to was rude and also the lady my friend spoke to on the plane was rude! My friend said the flight attendant had just shrugged her shoulders with a smirk on her face and said well we already canceled her and her sons flight. I had to sit in the Miami airport for 8hours with my 8year old son and they were just rude about the whole situation. Worst experience I’ve ever had.
Route: Miami to Las Vegas via Houston

FullReview: |  Tokyo to Boston via Washington. United has the worst customer service. I was afraid I was going to miss my connecting flight so I informed a crew member. All they had to say was: “we cannot help it”. I asked them if I can exit the plane first when it landed, and they refused. I missed my connecting flight and had to spend an additional 5 hours. I haven’t flown United after my first-time horrific experience. Never flying United again.

|  My flight from Chicago to New York La Guardia was supposed to leave at 5:00PM. Since then, the departure time has changed 6 times via the text updates. (5:55, 6:15, 7:30, 8:00, 7:45, 8:35) So I've just been sitting in the airport.  We were just told that they have "found a plane" that recently landed at 7:30, but we won't be leaving until 8:55  allegedly. The entertainment / wifi stuff on the first plane I took didn't even work.
Route: Chicago to New York La Guardia

FullReview: |  Chicago to Milwaukee via Nashville. Horrible experience. Friends flight was cancelled. Our flight had a three hour layover. When we finally got to Milwaukee we never got our luggage. They lost our luggage. We live four hours away from Milwaukee and had to pickup our friends at a different support in Appleton because of their cancellation. They had no idea where our luggage was! We sat at the airport for 5 hours waiting before giving up and having them send it via mail. Checked our bags in at 4.40am and it somehow didn't get to even Chicago until 5pm! Never flying with them again. They lost multiple peoples luggage that we talked to that day.

|  San Francisco to Tokyo Haneda. I've had mixed feelings about this airline. I was careless enough that the ANA ticket that I purchased was actually operated by United Airlines. The horrifying experience with them starts from customer service. I telephoned them obtaining inquiries on how a less than 24 hour transit would handle baggage. I was informed that the baggage will transfer directly to my connecting flight (which was finally, and thank heavens, ANA from Haneda to Manila). The reservation agent said that connecting within 24 hour transit will not result the baggage to be claimed in HND and will be directly handled in MNL. Fine. We checked in Day of our flight with our luggage weighing less than 50 lbs, 5 luggage due to my star alliance gold status, along with my brother's normal traveler status. We were informed that the luggage will be offloaded in Haneda. This is a conflicting to the information I was provided few hours ago. The check in agent said "You can just re-check in to your next flght" I asked her, "are you sure", she was proud to answer "NO". Why suggest with utmost certainty to do such thing without verifying your sources. I had asked for supervisor and I was replied with "We do not have a supervisor, he is busy!" I am at my point of my fumes reaching to the airport's ceiling on the way how I am being handled. Finally, the supervisor at that time came and handled our baggage with manual baggage tags. The check in agent even uttered "good luck in finding these bags", while the supervisor gave her a blank stare. These words were also added to our fiasco Agent: There is no way I will write manual airport codes with these baggage tags, they will get lost for sure. (At least she cares about my baggage possibility of being lost). Agent: Your baggage cannot be held at the airport for security purposes. Really, security purposes? I will travel with my luggage for more than 12 hours (note it will go through a strict security check, hence, adding another 12 hours should not make any difference to impose threat to security. I am not sure why United continue to impress us with their undying no customer style of service. It was not United Airlines ticket that I purchased, it was under ANA but unfortunately, the operating flight was United. The check-in agent did not offer us any help that at least by reaching Haneda, a ground staff would assist us with our luggage to connect to another airline. I guess by customer's putting up their weak customer service to even lower than worst, keeps them in the market. Never again.

|  We were flying from STL on United to ORD. The STL departure was 10 minutes behind schedule. When we arrived at ohare at terminal B, our connecting flight started boarding at terminal F. Our ticket including on the United app said gate F16, so we ran like home alone a mile through the airport. When we arrived (F16) they had not started boarding, so My wife left her phone and bag with me to use the bathroom. They had changed the gate to f17 with no notice and told me I needed to board and they’d wait for my wife. She didn’t have her phone or her ticket and I was rudely asked to board and leave my wife. They could have easily just explained let me take your carry on to load and wait for your wife. There would have been no way to communicate to my wife where she needed to go, where her bags went, and where I went. I wasn’t going to strand my wife and leave her behind. Then my wife returned and sprinted to get to the gate where I flagged her down. After getting on board, the gate attendant came back and continued berating me in front of the whole plane about not leaving my wife behind and denying to board until my wife was with me. Terrible service, never flying United again. I hope this gate attendant is made to undergo public relations training and learns how to speak politely to the people to the people who are why she gets paid. Frustrating experience where I was berated by an awfully rude gate attendant for not leaving my wife in a different city because United’s flights weren’t on time and they changed gates without any notification. Here’s to never flying with United again.

| Two customers and I missed connecting flights to Orlando by 10 minutes due to a previously delayed United Airlines flight from Paducah. United does not care about their customers whatsoever. How could they not communicate that they made a mistake and several customers would be arriving less than 10 minutes late to boarding time. Easily the worst airline I have ever flown. Terrible customer service.

|  Newark to Dallas Ft Worth. This airline is a glorified Spirit Airlines, nickel and dimming you for everything. I had a personal item that fit under my seat with no issue that was checked off by an agent on my flight to Newark. On my way back the agent refused to check off this same bag and said it was a carry on and had to pay $25. I could have paid the same amount including seat selection and carry on on another airline for less had I known without the hassle and frustration. The agents were incredibly rude. I  will never fly United if it’s the last thing I do. Terrible experience, customer service, pricing and policies.

|  So unhappy with United! On our way to Las Vegas our flight was delayed 3 hours which made it impossible to get our flight mid way, so we had to get a flight 6 hours after which means we ended up being in an airport for 12+ hours. Not only this but we didn’t even receive a notification that it was delayed so we couldn’t even go back home or do anything but just sit. Then they refused to let us sit together, on any of our flights, luckily there was one person who offered to switch seats. They acted like because we paid for the cheaper seats that’s how we were gonna be treated. We couldn’t even take a carry on with our flight it was just ridiculous. We flew Delta a little less than a year before this and paid for the same type of ticket and when we asked if we could sit next to each other they said no problem at all and allowed us to have a carry on. United also overbooked our flight by 5 people, I don’t understand how do you overbook? Plus when we got our flight we had to PAY to watch anything on their little TVs, where in Delta it’s paid for. I don’t get any of this. Just doesn’t make sense to me! Just not happy with them at all. We will never again fly United.

|  Cancún to Nashville via Chicago. United airlines is terrible. They postponed our flight twice in Cancun then promised we should still make our flight in Chicago to Nashville. We arrive in Chicago and the gate changed 5 different and kept getting postponed from 7:30p.m and finally gets cancelled at 12:00am, after spending 3 hrs in customer service line we get told the only flight out is 24hrs later and there are no accommodations. I will never fly United again. I would never suggest united airlines to anyone.

| Are you joking United? On my flight TO EWR from SEA, I had a 3 hour delay. Now on my flight from EWR to SEA, there’s a 25 min delay which turns into a 1 hour delay, which turns into a last minute gate change far away (just getting out of physical therapy mind you) which turns into another gate change back to original gate after I had made my way over to the new one and everyone is now still waiting in line with the aircraft yet to be seen. What are you guys doing? This is 2018 - learn about customer service - would’ve thought you should have learnt from all your mistakes in this area by now with all the lawsuits and bad press. Never flying United again, back to Alaska for me. Horrible experience.

| Fort Lauderdale to Salt Lake City via Denver. Did somebody shrink the size of the international carry on size? Or is it just United Airlines? Wouldn't let us bring our carry on as it didn't fit in their sample carry on box. It fit in Southwest's just fine. Non-existent customer service. We were not rude, just asked why it was small compared the other airlines. Not even about the 25$. Just tired of dealing with people trying to nickle and dime. Thought for a minute I was dealing with dish network or comcast. I always regret not flying with tried and true Southwest!
Route: Fort Lauderdale to Salt Lake City via Denver

FullReview: | Heathrow terminal 2 was pleasant enough and boarding started on time. The plane is old and lacks in a few places: built in screen was tiny and showed movies on a loop. The irony is they ask you to use your own device but don't provide any power. I could not get the app to work, I didn't try to find a flight attendant because I had a book. Seat was 25K in the extra legroom and they made it clear you could not just move into this section. I'd rather fly a 2-3-2 layout 767 than a 3-3-3 787. It's such as shame that the modern aircraft are so horrendously tight so you have a choice of space but old IFE/no power or IFE/power but really narrow seats. The legroom was not spectacular given the $140 cost. Food was poor. Chicken or pasta. I had the chicken and the liquid tasted like stewed tea. Didn't finish it and could see others left it. Snack before landing was much nicer. This was a very expensive ticket due to my particular needs for a specific day / route for work so I understand but it is still galling to know I surely paid more than a few of the business class passengers to sit back here.

|  I had the smoothest and the most comfortable ride on my flight back to Denver from Dallas. The flight crew was great. The only problem I had was at security at DFW. The United ticket agent cleared my under seat carry on. The power trip lady made get out of line and go back to the agent that cleared me when my under the seat carry on fitted on the check your baggage size. This cost me another 20 minutes in going back through a line that I had been in just for someone to say ok. This would be the only reason I would not fly United anymore. The power trip lady would cause me not to travel with them anymore. I understand security by all means protect me and my fellow Americans but a bag. For real.

|  San Francisco to Chicago. If you fly United you better get used to delays. Worst airline service ever. I fly almost every week, mostly of the time by United, but thinking seriously about a change to Delta.

|  London Heathrow to San Francisco. Our flight from London Heathrow to SFO, was a wonderful non eventful flight, except for the service! The staff and flight attendants were above par and the main flight attendant on our flight went above and beyond! He made sure not only we’re we satisfied on the flight, but I heard several passengers on the flight comment on how well he took care of them. Actually, all the flight crew members on our flight were so delightful and made our trip back to the States a joyous experience! Cheers to all of the United Crew for going above and beyond to make our travel experience so delightful! We will definitely fly International anytime with United! 5 Star Experience does not go unnoticed!

|  Houston to London via Newark.  This airline is unbelievably incompetent. I scheduled a flight from Houston to London to attend my mother’s wedding and it was canceled, delayed, then canceled again. I now have to buy $7k worth of British Airways flights so I can arrive on time and attend her wedding. After going to customer service for a refund they stated I’m Not eligible for a refund and told me good luck. I will never fly with United again. If you want to spend a few grand and a few days stuck in an airport,  choose United!

|  Newark to Saint Louis. After spending hours at the airport as the flight continued to be postponed until finally canceled due to “weather conditions” - when other airlines did not and the weather was fine in both cities, the customer service provided was very poor. I spent almost one hour to be able to rebook the flight and thank God I tried to check in right away with my reservation number because the email confirmation I supposed to receive never arrived. Then I found out that I did not have a seat assigned on my connecting flight when my wife did and I was never told that.

| Charleston to Newark. I have flown with United for 4 years consistently now and have never had such a horrible experience as today. Customer service was terrible, no help was given, and no solution so I am now flying Delta. I arrived almost an hour and half before my flight - at 5:30am, bags paid for online and check in online done. All I needed to do was put my bags on the flight and get on security line - the line was so long that they pushed the 6:50am flight customers to the front, but when one woman complained about it, they sent us back and said that the flights would stand by for us since so many of us were on those flights. Being sent to the back of the line made me not get to security until 6:25am, with boarding ending at 6:30am. Furious no one could help me or would, and I managed to run to the gate and miss my flight by 5 minutes. I planned according as I have done for every single flight I have ever taken out of Charleston, and missed my flight because of incompetence and the disregard of United and airport employees. When I called to try and book another flight the representative was also extremely unhelpful only offering the most expensive routes or flights for tomorrow when I needed to be home today. When we mentioned I would be taking Delta he started badmouthing Delta and how it would be better to take United - rude, unhelpful, and disrespectful. The horrid stories of this airline disregarding customers needs or even attempting to be helpful have never been more evident than today and I am overjoyed with the care and kindness shown by Delta airlines. There is no doubt in my mind I will never fly United again.

|  Houston to London. United is horrible. We paid $1,100 to upgrade to First Class 8-9 months prior to the flight. Get to the airport and we are NOT upgraded. They say we paid to be in a waitlist.  They say they will refund our money (and 40,000 miles) ASAP. I get my credit card statement and they have only refunded $550! Why? Both our flights were on the same ticket. I’ve complained three times, only to get emailed back by three different people. They have not offered me one little thing for a big inconvenience of not flying first class, much less trying to scam me out of $550. We fly pretty often and we are done with United!

|  Grand Rapids to Brussels via Chicago. Our first plane was grounded for maintenance, and were stuck in GR for 4 hours. We missed a day of vacation, lost our personal pick up, lost a day at the hotel and our first class Euro train tickets. I paid for German airlines and United messed up so bad we had to take United to New Jersey. Our New Jersey flight was taking off late but had to be returned do to an passenger not being able to fly. I had to rebuy my euro train pass for twice what I originally paid and later then my original ticket. When we got to Brussels there was an extra security check just for United. Our seats were not on the ticket, even though I bought the tickets 4 months ago. On the way home from Brussels the scheduled the flight so tight that we had to rush to make the plane. You were not able to buy any food on the plane either. When we got to Chicago, again the transfer flight was so close we barely had time to get through customs with a few minutes to spare running through the terminal. But it was ok because they didn't have a plane to fly. We were another 2 hours late getting home due to no plane and when they got a plane it was held up for maintenance problems again. Most of the time me and my girlfriend didn't even get to sit next to each other.
