So after paying for a hotel stay we didn't use, extra 100 dollars in taxi fees, airlines I specifically paid for and was not able to use, an extra 300 dollars in euro train fares and lost time visiting my very close friend I had not seen in 6 years. United said the best they could do was give me 60 dollars in food vouchers. It was a horrible experience. I feel so bad for the two employees out of 15 that actually were nice.
Route: Grand Rapids to Brussels via Chicago

FullReview: |  Las Vegas to Newark. Flight was delayed 45 minutes to board and another 45 minutes in the aircraft for take off clearance. I was very anxious because i had a connection after Newark and it was doubtful i could make it. I asked the flight attendant and she couldn’t care less - she told me call your travel agent. Can you believe that. At that time a male flight attendant also on business class told me that if there is a problem United will book me on the next flight and told me not to worry. How hard was what be did? He was probably the only one paying attention to the training. Also the power socket on my seat was off. Again the female attendant turned her head the other way. The male attendant just said give me your cell phone i will have it charged for you. Again so simple.

|  Miami to Seattle via San Francisco. This was the worst flight we’ve ever flown on and we were a party of 7, 5 children and two adults we had to sit on the plane for three hours before it took off and they didn’t take off - going to San Francisco should have it gone to Denver to refill with fuel and then it flew to San Francisco. Instead of getting there at approximately 10:00 PM we got there at 2am with five kids and the employees on the aircraft were super rude to our teenage kids. United airlines has the worst customer service we’ve ever seen on an airline they are just completely horrible they don’t take care of their passengers, especially people traveling with children. We had to stay in San Francisco overnight and then get all split up with the family because there were seven of us to be able to get flown home my husband left with four children at 9:45 and I could not get a flight with my other son until 4 o’clock the next day. It was completely horrible the process of getting rebooked took over two hours in the night time with nobody waiting in line and we had to have five people help us to get this all sorted out with the manager stepping in.
Route: Miami to Seattle via San Francisco

FullReview: |  Slow, thats how I feel everything goes on this airline. On my flight to visit family I didn’t make it to my destination until approx 26 hours from when I boarded the first flight. 3 flights later. We sat on tarmac at LAX for who knows (no one knew) said something with the bathrooms. They need to step up the efficiency made me miss my connecting. Sat on the plane for over an hour when I was almost the last one to board on the way back. This is just becoming commonplace with United I think. Please, people, we have places to be!

|  Tel Aviv to San Francisco. Polaris business class seat configuration of 2x2x2 in this Boeing 787-8. Not a typical configuration and a bit out of date set up. The seats are flat bed but all the lower part is not 180 degrees so if you are tall this seat is not comfortable at all – half part of your leg are in a strange angle. Food is not eatable and very basic. Service in minimal. Overall they do the minimum to take you in a 15hr flight. This time with no entertainment system at all -it was broken for all passengers

|  I was a bit nervous about flying United because I've heard so many bad reviews, but we flew from Dublin to Tampa via Washington and then Tampa to Dublin via Newark and on all 4 flights we were met with nothing but courtesy, efficiency, friendliness and helpfulness. There were delays encountered on the Tampa to Newark flight due to weather, but we were kept informed all along the way and were even booked onto a standby connection should we have missed our original connection in Newark. We caught the connection with minutes to spare and fully expected our luggage to miss the flight, but to our surprise and delight it was right there on the carousel when we arrived in Dublin. There was an off-duty Cabin Crew member sitting next to us on the Tampa to Newark flight and she was also helpful and friendly, even though she was off-duty. She got information for us about our connecting flight and showed us where the gate was. I would have no problem in recommending United to anyone, and will definitely be flying with them again.

|  Quebec to Newark. The staff was incredibly nice, but they had to follow whatever United airlines policy was. I was in Quebec City, where they speak both English and French. My carry on bag was forcefully checked in to be in cargo and it was not handled delicately, I was not told to take my laptop or valuables out, at least not in English, and my screen cracked in the process. I don't blame the staff, I blame a lack of communication and United Airlines wanting to check people's bags in so they don't have to deal with people needing to get their belongings out. Also, who ever handled cargo almost lost my luggage, I had to wait almost 24 hours to find out if they found it because it was a late transfer to the right connecting flight. From the update I got, it was in Chicago when my connecting flight was from Newark to San Jose.

|  Flying United was a great experience. A wonderful captain who kept us detailed through the flight and manuvered thru the turbulence. Me and my family cause a hold up for the other passengers by being the last people on board and the captain waited for us. We had 3 kids and they were more than patient making us feel as though we we're first class when we definitely we're not. The staff was kind and caring and wonderful with kids.

|  Newark to Dublin. Most unfriendly staff ever. We are a family of 3 flying with a 3 year old, the flight is early in the morning, so we had toddler, who was sleep deprived and  we had separate seats with my husband. We asked at the gate to help us to seat together, explaining that it’s easier to handle our son together, but nobody bothered, basically, we were told, that’s our issue. In the plane my son has tantrum with crying, we tried to talk to other passengers, asking if there is a way to switch, no luck. Flight attendants just pass by saying “You are his mom, deal with it”, threatening to stop the plane taking off if I couldn’t have him seated. My explanation that I need at least my husband’s help or the window seat (preferably the second) are ignored. Finally, there is one very nice flight attendant (the only one who seems to care about passengers) who was able to switch us to the window seats, we calmed down our son and he fell asleep. Other flight attendants gave us really bad attitude, as if being a parent means to have a magic wand that will make a 3-year old behave like an adult and quietly sit through the 7-hour flight. In addition, there was no child meal that I ordered, and he refused to eat whatever they offered for adults (the food looked awful), so he had only muffin and a couple of cookies during the entire flight. Most family unfriendly airline, worst flight ever.

|  Peoria to Ft. Lauderdale via Chicago. The actual flight was fine and the staff was friendly but watching the crew literally toss the luggage on the assembly line to be put on the plane really annoyed me. Thankfully my suitcase has a hard outer shell, but more care should be taken with paying customers’ luggage.
Route: Peoria to Ft. Lauderdale via Chicago

FullReview: |  Corpus Christi to Houston. Extremely rude flight attendant. I expressed that I had a very short time to make my connecting flight and she just said to leave my baggage outside the plane. You are allowed 1 carry on and 1 personal item. Both of my bags are not in my possession. I believe that United as a whole is a failure and needs to revamp the customer service they use to have. I am extremely disappointed almost every time I fly with United.

| Tampa to Houston. United is very unorganized and unaccommodating. We purchased two tickets at the same time and we are seated 17 rows apart! When we asked if there were any seats closer they had a quick now and asked us to move on. This airline seems to do little to show any shred of customer care. We will not be using this airline again.

| Chicago to Miami. So if I spend first class money, I expect first class accommodations. Purchased two round trip tickets for my wife and I. Both flights were first class. The outbound flight had a wonderful and friendly staff. But I was incredibly disappointed in the food choices. A burger is not an attractive option for a first class meal. Especially one with just cheese as a topping, and no lettuce, tomato, onion or anything. Plus I don’t eat meat, so I was thoroughly disappointed. Worse was the return flight. The seat, tray table and armrest was absolutely filthy. I did not feel comfortable sitting in the seat. It looked like it hadn’t been cleaned in days. Old food crumbs, hair, dust was prevalent. Could not believe United let this happen. I worked my way up in life to enjoy luxury. This ain’t luxury. I’d rather spend my hard earned money with another airline for real first class.

|  Nashville to Amsterdam via Washington-Dulles. We will never fly United again. Due to a mechanical failure, we were asked to get off our flight from IAD-AMS after an hour on the tarmac. We were then asked to check back at the gate in an hour for a status update, at which point they told us to check back in another two and a half hours, though they were already pulling our bags off the plane. It was obvious the flight was not going to take off, but we were strung along for three hours. When it was finally cancelled, we were asked to walk a half a mile from service desk at D15 to C20. Once there we waited for yet another hour in line. Here is where it got absurd…At the desk the United Service Rep printed out a hotel and 6 meal vouchers for us. While they are printing, our Rep and the other customer service reps were looking at the vouchers and talking about the fact they just said "invoice" on them next to payment method and how that was not normal. The manager comes out and tells them that "it will be fine and just keep printing them." The Rep hands the vouchers to us and away we go. We wait in line for the shuttle then wait in line for the Westin service desk only to find out the vouchers do not work since there is no credit card associated with them or no established account with the Westin!!! After waiting to get on the phone with one of the United service reps at Dulles, the rep tells us we must go back to the airport to pick up a new voucher with a number! Fortunately Westin knows how to provide Customer service and convinces the United Rep at Dulles to just send over some form via email and puts us up even without a payment method. This negotiation lasted two hours. At this point we have been traveling for 11 hours with only 1 hour in flight. Also none of our food vouchers work at the hotel for the same reason. The next morning we find out the United has not yet sent the form over or paid Westin for our stay. This is the third United flight I have taken in the last 2 months that has either been overbooked or cancel by mechanical failure. United flights are unreliable and their customer service is appalling. All they do is pass the blame and never resolve the issues they have caused. I urge you to not fly them and hopefully one day their awful customer service will put them out of business.

|  Detroit to Richmond. I fly monthly for my business and have experience with multiple airlines - United is the worst! Flew from Detroit to Richmond VA with an 1.5 hour layover in Washington Dulles. Landed in Washington only to be told there was a 5 hour delay on my flight to Richmond. Considering that I needed to get to Richmond early, I asked if there were any other options. Spoke with multiple United employees and their response was to drive the rest of the way. I had no choice, so I decided to rent a car. Then I was told they would not get my luggage off the plane, even considering the plane was going to be there for 5 hours. After speaking to multiple employees, I luckily found one that retrieved my bag. Now on my return, i drive to Richmond airport and then receive a text telling my that my flight from Richmond to Washington Dulles is delayed 3 hours and I would not make my flight back to Detroit. Luckily I had not returned my rental car yet, I park and go in to speak to an agent. Once again, nothing they can do. I have to switch my rental location back to Washington Dulles and drive there as fast as I can to make my flight back home. No options offered, no offer to cover my rental cost, nothing - dont fly United.

| Kalispell to Raleigh via Denver. I bought three airline tickets in January for our trip in March. On both our flights to NC and returning to MT we were spread out between multiple rows and not able to sit together. In addition we were all in the middle seats of the various rows. It makes no sense to me why a family of 3 traveling together cannot sit together. I will never fly United again.

|  I scheduled a round trip from Ontario to San Francisco. I was told my flight was cancelled due to weather condition at the counter when I was trying to check, and they said they sent me a text, which I received during my check in. I asked the lady who works at the Untied Counter, what are the alternative since the flight is cancelled, she told me I can take another flight which is about 2 hours away (Burbank CA), or come back tomorrow, I asked her how do I get to Burbank, she told me "I don't know, I don't deal with transportation." Then I asked her "Am I going to get reimbursement?" she replied: "I only check you in, I don't know about reimbursement, you should call United." I was on a business trip and my schedule was tight, and as I insist on a solution, at the next counter, China Airline's employee felt bad and helped me to found a solution to fly from the same airport going to San Francisco. As I was waiting for my flight, I tried to contact United, I was trying to get an idea of the situation of my reimbursement, and was on queries for 2 hours, until I got on the plane. On the way back, as I got to the counter for check in, United Airline employee told me that my flight was cancelled because they put me on the Burbank flight (without my approval) and since I did not show up on the flight, they cancelled my round trip. They said they tried to contact me and maybe because I was in the sky when they called, but since I didn't call them back, I am liable for this result. At the counter I just wanted to go home and told them I just want to buy a ticket now (I already told my friends when to pick me up, and unlike United, I don't want to change what was schedule.) And the lady was like you can buy it with your phone. I insisted on her booking the ticket for me (I didn’t want to have the risk of, where I brought a ticket online and the counter told me they can't find it) then she tried to book me for about 10 minutes and told me "I am going to have to stop booking for you since you are about to past the 30 minutes limit to board the flight." And Later on I found out the person who is "more" familiar with the ticketing was on lunch. The most disgusting part is their attitude and the situation they put you in, "I am not responsible for your schedule." "You didn't show up for your flight," "I am not in charge of reimbursement," "you should have booked your ticket online." Never ever United.

| United has accommodated me and my family on business as well as pleasure trips over the past 17 years. They have always been helpful when we found ourselves in a quandary and over the years I remember only one incident where I was upset about the quality of customer service when dealing with United employees. Today United came through for me again, far above and beyond the call of fair customer service: my FF status expired in Feb as I had a slow travel year in 2017 and I also missed the March 11th deadline for purchasing a reinsted status, however, a very pleasant and helpful customer rep went the extra mile for me and requested an exception since I’ve been a loyal customer for years - and not only did United reinstate my silver status but they did it for free ($680 value as quoted to me in March). United has my loyalty!

| Flew United Airlines from London Heathrow to Los Angeles. Aircraft very clean. Crew were pleasant and nice. I had paid extra for Economy plus for the legroom. The food was actually very good. The only issue is the tiny portions. The seat back padding is minimal. There is room for the seats to be 1 inch wider each side. Overall considering the terrible reviews that United usually gets, I think they were better than my flight over to London on Virgin Atlantic.

|  Houston to Frankfurt via Atlanta. Traveling for Spring Break with my family. Got delayed first day and rebooked on next day and cancelled next day. We couldn’t leave Houston for 2 consecutive days. We had to cancel our travel. Thank you United, never use them again. Domestically Southwest are much better,  internationally much better to rely on Lufthansa, Air France, KLM. United is just unreliable and can’t manage its fleet.

|  My husband and I flew from Newark to Las Vegas. We purchased the tickets a few months before the flight and I was advised to contact United to inform them of my pet allergies. I called 10 days before the flight and was told that there were no animals booked for either direction. I was then told to call back 24 hours prior to the flight as there were a few available seats and the pet policy requires 48 hour prior notification. I called back and was offered a seat in the pet-free area (for $200 more each direction) which I declined as there were no pets booked and we were in the home stretch, the 48 hour notification deadline. I was told to notify the gate agent on arrival. At the airport my bag was pulled for inspection as they x-rayed my book and did a thorough check on my EpiPen. When we finally arrived I let the agent at the gate know about my allergies and was informed that he didn’t know if there were any animals on the flight. He told me that it was policy to book anyone with allergies on the next available flight if there were pets onboard. I asked if the next flight had any pets booked as my husband tried desperately to pull me away from the counter but, not before I heard the agent reply that he didn’t know. He did know that my husband and I would be seated in separate rows, 15 rows difference to be exact. As we boarded, our carry on was removed and banished to the bowels of the plane. I said farewell to my luggage and husband, got seated, cracked my book, and took a deep breath. That’s when I began giving my seat mate some serious side-eye to see if she was covered in cat hair as I scratched at my hives and waved away pet fur. I took 2 Benadryl and started hitting the bottle, of eye drops that is. Hour fours, two more Benadryl (that’s four if you’re counting) and a full bladder. I stood up to use the restroom and peered over the seat directly in front of me and that’s when I see it. A stressed out, full shed-mode, Pomeranian sitting on his owners lap. He pants as his owner strokes his fur creating the snow globe from hell. Who knew sitting 15 rows away from your husband would come in handy. I passed the baton (bottle of pills and tissues cause he’s allergic to dogs too) and ran to the critter free zone. To be fair, I am an animal lover but, the pet policies have to be addressed. I’m not the only allergy sufferer and you’ll have a hard time convincing me that this particular dog was a seeing eye dog, a seizure dog, a PTSD pooch or anything but the fluffy family pet. I followed the airlines rules and look where it got me, the run around, and a trip to urgent care for a sinus infection. Oh yeah, crazy small seats, no WiFi, piss poor customer service! Taking JetBlue to Aruba this month. No more United flights for me.

| Flew United from Chicago to Beijing. Lacking customer service skills. The $150 upgrade was only so I could get a window seat. All of the regular economy seats were only offering middle seats. They take up half of the economy cabin with upgrades, so if you buy a late ticket, you have to upgrade to get a decent seat. Flight attendants were rude (both flights), and the food was awful. I normally have such great experiences with international flights, especially with Delta. This was beyond disappointing.

| I have been flying a minimum of 3x a year for the last 25 years. I never really have problems, other than the occasional unexpected flight delay due to weather. I also haven’t flown United in a couple of years. I purchased my economy tickets through Expedia for a little 5 day trip. Prices didn’t vary but about $5 as compared to others. When I went to do online check in 24 hours prior to flight, I learned I had to check my small suitcase, that I have always carried on before. I travel very light. One small carry on and one backpack. I was told I was not allowed the suitcase and had to check it and pay $25 each leg. Ridiculous. I then had to wait in baggage claim, which I never had to do before. I’ve decided I will not be flying United again for this very reason. This change in policy is taking you out of the market as compared to other airlines. People that travel light typically go economy, and they travel light to avoid delays like waiting in baggage claim. Bad decision United.
ReviewTitle: "I will not be flying United again"
Route: Oklahoma City to Destin Florida via Houston

FullReview: |  Oklahoma City to Destin via Houston./ I have been flying a minimum of 3x a year for the last 25 years. I never really have problems, other than the occasional unexpected flight delay due to weather. I also haven’t flown United in a couple of years. I purchased my economy tickets through Expedia for a little 5 day trip. Prices didn’t vary but about $5 as compared to others. When I went to do online check in 24 hours to flight, I learned I had to check my small suitcase, that I have always carried on before. I travel very light. One small carry on and one backpack. I was told I was not allowed the suitcase and had to check it and pay $25 each leg. Ridiculous. I then had to wait in baggage claim, which I never had to do before. I’ve decided I will not be flying United again for this very reason. This change in policy is taking you out of the market as compared to other airlines. People that travel light typically go economy, and they travel light to avoid delays like waiting in baggage claim. Bad decision United.
Route: Oklahoma City to Destin via Houston

FullReview: |  Booked flight 6 months ago. Our transferring flight to come home was pushed forward about 2 hours. Our flight lanes on schedule, as soon as we departed the plane I asked customer service if we were going to miss our flight. They immediately confirmed before going through customs or security. At this point we had already traveled for 21 consecutive hours, this additional delay increased our total travel time from 23 hours to 30 hours. Especially tough when traveling with an infant. I believe United was fully aware that we wouldn’t be able to make our connecting flight but did not notify us because we would have canceled our tickets. On the other hand, if it would have lead to us staying in a hotel for 1-2 nights I believe United would have let us know. Basically they are only out to protest their bottom dollar and have no consideration for the inconvenience they caused. We declined the $50 travel voucher they offered and will not be using United again.

| Flying from Bozeman, MT to Maui, HI with a layover in SFO, the first flight said it was delayed by nearly an hour and a possibility of missing my next flight, however our flight from BZN made it just in time for myself and several other passengers to high tail it to the connecting flight to Maui (OGG). The gate was still open with passengers loading, the ticket agents said to see the gate attendant to myself and the other 2 folks who were also connecting(with a line of people there). After several minutes (and the gate was still open) the agent finally looked up my boarding pass and said they had actually sold my full fare first class ticket to someone else, because they thought our flight would be too late! The agent was very curt and rude, offered no compensation, he put me on the next flight 4+ hours later in a bad coach seat next to a screaming baby with no food service on an evening 5.5 hr flight! That flight by the way also did not take off on-time as we sat on the aircraft for another 50 extra min making it a nearly 7 hr flight time. not the first terrible flight on United either.
Route: Bozeman to Kahului via San Francisco

FullReview: |  Sydney to Cancun via Houston. Within 2 hours of take off was told there was no red wine left, with 13 hrs still to fly, we had had two glasses of red wine each. Staff were non existent, didn’t come when the Call light was serviced, and when did appear were very rude as we had clearly interrupted them. Overall cleanliness and condition of plane was disgraceful and we were apparently on a new Boeing 787. Were told internet and spirits were available but once in the air found out this was at an extra charge. We are dreading the return flight home but unfortunately have no other choice. Pay the extra and fly with someone else.

|  West Palm Beach to Newark. The overall experience has been absolutely horrible. Our flight was suppose to be at 11am but was delayed until 3:30 because of a “technical issue”. Shockingly there was no mechanic at this airport to fix the issue so one had to come from Orlando which took 4hrs. Older people who were waiting for news in wheelchairs were treated with disregard. New people were put on this plane by the airline only to face this grueling experience. Finally, after almost 5hrs of waiting, the flight was cancelled. Completely disgusted with the unprofessionalism and lack of care that took place. Will never fly United again.

| United has always let me down whenever I have flown with them. They are usually delayed and had me wait over two hours for a flight before. So when I was going home by them again I accepted that it wasn’t going to be a fun trip. I didn’t know it was going to be this bad. First off my flight started off late and the plane got to the airport 20 minutes later then we should have. They did not tell us why we were late though. Not only was it late but we had to wait longer than necessary to get our carry-on luggage that wouldn’t fit on the actual plane. Due to all of this we missed our connecting flight. When we finally found the right gate (since it was switched on us at least twice) the flight had already boarded and the door closed. The attendant at the desk was rude and condenscending when she told us that it was closed and the plane left. We proceeded to wait in the customer service line for two hours in order to talk to a rep who didn’t know anything and had to ask her supervisor on every little question. She tried to figure out why the flight was late but found no reason or explanation why. She said yes the flight was delayed but since there was no reason for it she could not get us a hotel room or even a discount on one. The next flight to South Dakota wasn’t until ten the next morning which would have been too late for the event we needed to get to. We asked if we could be refunded and found a flight back to Tulsa. After a lengthy phone call they decided that they can only get us on the next flight back to Tulsa which was at 2pm the next day and if we want to be refunded we will have to call a number and jump through some more hoops even though it’s the airlines fault for us missing our connecting. We asked if we could possibly fly back on Sunday. Since we were already in Denver we didn’t want to shoot our entire weekend down the drain. She replied with a no due to policy. So here we are in the Denver airport at 10.30 at night with no luggage food or a room. We are missing a baptism. With how we were treated and hurt I am now going to make every effort to never fly United again. I will also never recommend this airline.

|  Montreal to New York with United, connecting to Avianca and Tam to Sao Paulo / Salvador. My partner and I won't fly again with United Airlines. First of all, they started by "forgetting" to reimburse us a pair of tickets (worth more than 3000$), even after we called to make sure we had not been ticketed. When we had tried to purchase our ticket, they were not able to confirm to us our tickets within 24 hours, so their policy was that our tickets would be canceled - we would not be charged. We took extra precautions by calling them to make sure we were not charged, and were reassured that we would not be charged. One month later we find out in our credit card statement that we had actually been charged. This is not a mistake of charging 10$ extra to costumers, it's more than 3000$! Moreover, we had to wait about 2 weeks to get the full reimbursement once we called them. And lot's of talking over the phone. Second, during our trip, we wanted to change the origin and date of one of our flights. However, when calling United Airlines during multiple days and talking to several agents, some would say we could not change the origin of our ticket. No where on the ticket does it say we cannot change the origin. Also, we spoke to about 5 agents who told us all kinds of different rules and policies (often contradictory) - all with the same end: they would not let us change one of our flights. They told us we had to "stick to our initial route" and there were not changes possible. The call center staff is  unprofessional, scattered around the world and all saying different policies, rules, etc. We wasted so much time. As mentioned, we will never fly with them again, we feel scammed, they took our money and that's it.

| Flew San Francisco to Los Angeles. I booked so called "Basic Economy" which is a new way that United Airlines uses to trick and trap customers. Of course I ended up paying $50 for two carry-on bags for each of us (one of them is really small and just because it has 4 wheels). If this is the way they treat customers and make money now, they are digging their grave aggressively. Company like this is really badly managed and have no reputation whatsoever. UA is on my never-to-take again black list and I will warn all people I know to be careful to watch out for their tricks.
ReviewTitle: "ended up paying $50 for two carry-on bags"

FullReview: |  Houston to Los Angeles. Before my first flight departed, I expressed concern to a flight attendant, because there was only 16 minutes from when the flight landed until my next flight started boarding. She stated to me that we would probably be arriving early so there would be enough time for me and they could ask the passengers to remain seated letting me off the plane. Neither these things were true. I get to the gate at LAX three minutes passed when boarding was meant to end. It is isolated and not a single employee nor other passengers are around. I pace around looking for someone but the doors are shut. I rush back to a staffed customer service stand for answers. The woman I had the displeasure of talking to was in "Customer Service." Can I have your last name? No. Do you have an employee identification number? I can't give it to you. She calls my gate and discovers the employees were in the jetway. She then continues to bang away on her computer keyboard for several minutes. There was absolutely NO attempt to help me make my flight. She notifies me that the soonest I can leave is not until tomorrow afternoon. I tell that is not going to work for me. She does not care. That was that. What else can you do? Nothing. How else can I get there? You can drive. I openly express my frustration. About how I asked for help from the flight attendant, she does not care. I demand that there must be something else she can do and at this she picks up the phone to call security. She then says to me "we're done, you are not willing to listen, we're done." And at this, refuses to help me and sends me away. I come back to her and said that I was going to need a hotel room for the night. She responds with, "I am not helping you with anything." You are not going to get me a hotel? She uses this as an opportunity to lecture and chastise me about I should have listened to her and if I wouldn't have left the terminal [to find a human being to help me] then I wouldn't have missed my flight. I have a diagnosis of generalized anxiety disorder which I am medicated for. This employee caused me to go into a panic attack which I could not breathe and started to black out. I tried explaining to her I have an anxiety disorder to which she responded with, "yeah I can tell." It was the most violating and humiliating thing anyone had ever said to me. How dare one of their employees mock a paying customer who expresses that her medical diagnosis is affecting her.

|  Denver to Minneapolis. My flight was supposed to go out at 1:12 PM then got delayed six different times. Finally boarded the plane at 3:15 and ended up sitting on the plane for 2.5 hours. I decided to deboard the plane having already missed a funeral that I was supposed to be at in Minneapolis that afternoon. Filed a claim to get my bags return to Denver international airport after having to check my carry-on bag due to overcrowding on the aircraft. Spoke to a woman at United customer service who assured me my bag will be back the following morning at 7 AM. Return to the airport after having to get a hotel that evening. Returned to the airport only to find out my bag had come back to DIA, then was sent back to Minneapolis. Had to wait six hours at the airport before my bag was returned.

|  Houston to Atlanta. Literally never again. I bought new baggage to accommodate their “basic economy” requirements to ensure I wouldn’t have to pay their $25 handling fee + checked bag fee ($30 for my flight, it’s different based on aircraft etc). From ATL to Houston, no problems - return from Houston to ATL though, they stopped me at the gate and said I couldn’t take my bag onboard despite the blue they put on my bag at check in approving it for my ticket. I insisted they were wrong and they tried to argue. I was close to losing my temper and they just said “ok ma’am go on,” as if they were just trying to appease me. Never acknowledged that my bag was the right dimension for my ticket. I went out of my way to follow their rules and was treated like I tried to get away with something. I’ll never use them again, and no one in my company will either. The ticket wasn’t even economical.

|  Denver to Portland. United Airlines has one of the most asinine and exploitative reservation and ticketing practices of all the airlines. Breaking Economy into a Basic Economy removes half the options for passengers upfront, and further alienates them by requiring an in person Check In process at a kiosks if they have any bags at all. Their app literally will not let you check in online if you are basic economy, without charging you $25. I fly out of Denver so United represents 75% I can take and they know how to get you on flight selection, ticketing, check in.

| Flew Los Angeles to Chicago. Never again. Rude rude workers and the fact that carry-ons aren't allowed anymore is annoying. We weren't assigned a seat until we were boarding and our group was separated. When we were checking in there were 2 workers attending everyone checking in.

| Paris to Austin via Washington. United is the worst airline for international travel. I honestly dont know where to start. The rude employees, the bathrooms on the flight, the “food”, the uncomfortable seats, the cleanliness of the cabin is all bad. I intend on flying any other airline for all my travel personal or business moving forward. This airline digusts me.

|  
Tampa to Houston. Staff mistreated us while we were attempting to check in at the front desk. We walked up to the computer to start our check in process and got to the point at which we needed a United official to assist (since we were flying basic economy). It took the 5 ladies behind the desk about 15 minutes to make their way to us. This is remarkable knowing that only about 4 computers were in use and we had our hands raised/waving for 5 minutes. The employees  ignored us until we  waved at one while reaching over the counter. When the lady finally made her way over to us she took us to check the size of our backpacks in the personal item container. It was a tight fit but they could definitely fit. The lady began to explain that if we did not check our bags, they would charge us at the gate a higher fee. We have ridden basic economy on about 6 flights each (a total of 12 flights) and have never had an issue fitting our bags under the seats in front of us. This lady was saying "they are going to grab you at the gate and make you pay $100."  She then went on to record our information after approving us. We didn't get charged, obviously, since our bags fit in the personal bag space. United has lost us as customers.

|  Denver to Washington. They have shrunk the width of the seats to such an extreme you feel crammed. There is literally no wiggle room and I'm not a large person. I feel sorry for the man next to me. Boarding on time, flight crew pleasant. They need to make room for real people and stop monetizing their passengers.

|  Tel Aviv to San Francisco. I was excited to try the Boeing 787  new Polaris at united. We had a nice welcome with the team and find my 6B seat The configuration is a bit tight- 2x2x2. Usually I see 1x2x1 in this 787 for business class. The seat was comfortable but the issue the for 185 cm and up- there is no space of your legs. Really disappointment. Service was so so, when I asked for the flippers that are in the menu ( we are so proud of verity of things we can offer to you just ask the air crew…- as it was written…) air crew forget what you asked - overall disappointment

|  Chicago to Des Moines. Worst service ever. Flight was delayed 3 hours and they switched the departure gate 3 times. All participating United Staff seemed thoroughly confused and did not know details about the flight. I would not recommend United to anyone of my friends or family at this point.

|  Everything was good with the flight, my issue was that they lost track of my baggage and I ended up receiving it 10 days later, they did not give me any compensation for the issue and every time I called them to ask for my baggage they were clueless to where they were and when they would arrive. Very disapointed because of this.

| Flew United Airlines from San Jose California to Houston Texas. I bought a ticket for my aunt who has Alzheimer's and bought her premium economy so she has more leg room and made sure she had an aisle seat to grab an attendant if she needed help. They moved her seat four times! Each time I had to call and say, she can not be put in economy, that is not what I paid for, and she can not be in a window seat! She has to be able to flag an attendant if she needs something! They tried putting her in a window seat, economy instead of premium economy, etc.. Dealing with a person that has Alzheimer's is bad enough, dealing with a horrible airline that I had to call several times to argue about why they cant move her seat is just horrible. They have notes in their system that she has this medical issue and I think they are trying to take advantage of that!
Route: San Jose California to Houston Texas

FullReview: | Worst flight experience of my life. Sat on the runway for two hours in Baltimore, so I missed my connecting flight in Newark to Norfolk. Was forced to spend the night in New Jersey, and the airline refused to give me a hotel voucher. I had to pay $100 for a hotel due to the airlines negligence. The customer service was incomprehensibly rude. It was as if they thought this was funny. I have never experienced an airline as terrible as United.

|  
Raleigh Durham to New York. The worst of any service that I have encounter. They were late for my first flight which result that I could not get on my second flight to Hong Kong. I got my travel agent go online and there are flights available but the site agent will not honor. The first agent is ignorant and the second agent is trying to verbally fight with me. I'm paying for this ticket but treated badly. I should have know when I chose this United Airlines; this name is not fitted for them.

|  Honolulu to San Francisco. Our flights to and from Hawaii were great! Even though there was an issue with the WiFi they made sure everyone was able to log on quickly and gave iPads for those who couldn’t log on. Also we ended up confusing our flight that was on Alaska and a similar flight and time was at United. When we realized this at the United help desk it was too late to get to our Alaska flight within seconds they put us on their flight and offered to move our bags to that flight as well.  Also those German waffle cookie things are heaven.

|  Boston to Hong Kong via Newark. My flight BOS-EWR was delayed due to late arrival of the aircraft and I had a short connection in EWR to continue towards HKG. The customer service is unhelpful, as if the delay is your fault, not theirs. They refused to board me on an earlier flight, they could not offer re-routing nor sponsor the ticket with another airline to secure my journey. The delay was ultimately tight for my connection, but every UA representative I spoke to suggested the other flight would have likely waited. It did not. It left six minutes earlier than scheduled. Despite asking to the flight attendants while on flight whether my connection would have waited, the response was that United - differently from every other Star Alliance company - does not offer this "service". I landed and there was no representative to direct delayed passengers. I rushed to the gate to make the unpleasant discovery that my connection departed earlier. I thus went for the customer service. I stood on a line for 3h and 15m. Around 45 minutes after landing, a text message invited me to check-in for my next flight, from which I derived I was booked for the same flight the following day. After hours of waiting, I reached a representative that handed me a voucher for the hotel and US$ 30 for three meals: yes, $ 10 per meal. Not to mention, the hotel was sketchy and sub-standard. The flights were possibly the worst I have ever experienced in 14 years of flying. In over 16h flight (plus boarding, taxing, etc.) they serve two microscopic meals and one snack. No snacks in the galley. Never seen such misery. The crew was confrontational at all stages. They said: "We are nice to people who are nice to us", which is reasonable in abstract, but they seem to forget we are not fellow travellers! I am the customer, they are the flight attendants. As I have reached my final destination over 25h later than initially scheduled, I sought compensation from United. Unsurprisingly, their customer service is dismissive. I was told I can buy insurance next time. I do have insurance, but they cover unforeseeable events, not negligence of the carrier. I have been trying to hold them liable under the Montreal Convention, but so far all they offer are pointless vouchers in the illusion that I would ever subject myself again to the pain of dealing with such an unpleasant, unprofessional, unapologetic company. United airlines punishes you for making the unwise choice of traveling with them. Despite you pay for a service, they drop on you the cost of their inefficiency. Leaving aside old aircrafts, primitive forms of IFE that have disappeared in the rest of the world, broken controls, dirty and hard seats, meals that not even if you live out stamps. The point is the lack of consideration, the way they treat a paying customer at every stage of the experience, from check in to customer service when you try to claim damages for the disservice they caused you. Finally, UA cheats selling tickets with connecting time they cannot really respect or guarantee. They are cheating to rank higher on search engines with prices and journey duration. On any international flight, make sure you have 2.5h connecting time minimum. Few reviews will tell you UA is less worse than they say: don't gamble with it. Choose better.
Route: Boston to Hong Kong via Newark

FullReview: |  Houston to Oklahoma City. I have flown United twice now and both times were awful. They had an issue getting us checked in and because of that, we didn't get checked in before the 30 minute requirement on international flight so they wouldn't let us on our flight. Then on the way back, our flight was cancelled. Their customer service representatives do not care and are rude. Their flight attendants are rude. They do not care that your flight was cancelled and you need to get home because you have kids, work etc. They didn't even want to give us a food or beverage voucher. I will never use United again. It was a horrible experience!

| Flew Newark to Seoul via San Francisco. I am a frequent flyer with United. They have my complete profile including food preference as vegetarian. However, they always starve me saying that I haven't notified the airline about my special meal. Crew are always rude and do not make any effort to provide me with suitable food. I am sure they have other food options suitable for vegetarians but they just get away with a sorry! I would never fly United.
Route: Newark to Seoul via San Francisco

FullReview: |  Washington to London. The worst airline I have flown. Firstly for a flight of 7-8 hrs the Boeing 757 is a small plane with little or no leg space and cramped up passengers cos seats are 3-3. Thus each time I need to go to washroom both middle seat and isle seat passengers need to get out of their seats too which is really inconvenient to all passengers. Secondly there was no inflight entertainment despite the crew restarting the system several times which is outrageous for a long haul flight. Furthermore, there was no apology from crew until the flight landed in Heathrow where the crew finally apologised and said passengers to go online and get an appreciation voucher from United. This when I did that it gave me a USD100 discount code on any United Airlines with many conditions attached to it, unfortunately I won’t be flying United again at any cost, therefore even this voucher is of no use. On positive side I landed safely and food and drinks was ok for an international flight.

| Flew Newark to London Heathrow. United apply the recipe of discount airlines to long flight and this is not going well. Their organisation in Newark airport is chaotic. The entertainment system look like it's from the 90's (Ridiculously small screen and no possibility of movies selection). The inflight service is minimum and/or replaced by paying service. The food is well bellow any standard of what you can expect on a transatlantic flight.

| Could have driven faster, came from Chicago to Aspen, Aspen to Bozeman but didn't make it to Bozeman until 4.5 hours later after stopping in Great Falls. so glad I woke up at 2am to get there after 2pm. To top it off, now our baggage is broken. Wonderful. Thank you for an awesome trip to remember.

| Do not fly United. My husband and I flew round trip from Tulsa to Los Angeles with a connecting flight in Houston, TX. The trip there wasn't too bad other than the fact that they had t.v,s on the seat in front of you with direct t.v. and a remote control on the armrest. The problem was most of the remotes didn't work, and you couldn't change the channel. It was ridiculous. We didn't mind too much though, because we were more excited for our trip than concerned with our 4 hour flight stuck on one channel we didn't choose. The real problem came during our trip. We were supposed to fly back from LAX at 10 pm on December 31, 2017. We got an email late at night on the 29th, we didn't even see it until the morning of the 30th, saying our flight was changed. Just like that they changed our flight to 12:50am on the 30th. We lost basically a whole day that we had already planned out with relatives with basically no notice because they overbooked the flight. But we went anyway. At the airport almost 30 people were on standby for our flight. Then we were delayed over an hour. Then we flew to Houston, TX for a two hour layover. Then back on a plane to Tulsa. It made for a very long, very angry night. I'd pay an extra $150 a ticket or more before I'd ever fly United again. They do not care about their customers or our plans. This was a terrible experience.

|  San Francisco to San Diego. So ridiculous and simply unprofessional. I have a connecting flight here in San Francisco, I arrived 4 hours before my connection leaves. I looked at a departures board and noticed another United flight left in just an hour. Went to the United customer service desk to see if I could switch. The woman at the counter didn't have the decency to great me with a hello and before I even finished asking my question she told me there was nothing I could change at all. Her response was simply "no changes". I went to the gate and asked if there were seats available, the gate attended said "possibly" then looked at my ticket and informed the contract I signed when booking basic economy forbid me from changing flights. I asked "even if there are empty seats on an earlier flight?" And she said "no changes can be made with this ticket if it were economy I might be able to do something". I'm happy the gate employee at least explained my situation but this is ridiculous. United wanted to charge me another $35 for this trip to be economy. I paid $75 so that's nearly a increase. I understand I bought a cheap ticket, that's why I wasn't even allowed a carry on bag. However, when there's something as simple as putting a passenger, with no carry on or checked luggage, on the same size aircraft going to the same destination and United won't do it. That's ridiculous. It wouldn't cost them a dime more but I wasn't at the right paygrade for the company to care. Basically what I heard from United today was "give me money and I'll give a sh*t about you". Needless to say, they won't be getting my business in the future.

|  Orlando to Newark. United economy class was absolutely terrible. You cannot even take on a carry on, you must check your bag if you are in this class. My flight was cancelled due to inclement weather, and there was barely any flexibility in my flight change (had to be moved to the next day, but very limited in support), zero flexibility in allowing a carry on even though more time had been accrued, and very little acknowledgment of the difficulty that arises with a flight cancellation. I fly often, within the US and internationally. If I can help it, I will never fly United again.

| Due to fly United Airlines from Billings to Denver. Today is just another frustrating flight on United. 5.30pm flight already delayed until 8pm. Wont be suprised if flight gets cancelled. Last time I flew United I actually rented a car at midnight in Denver and drove 8 hours home rather than get stranded in Denver for 1.5 days with no hotel or any compensation. When I was flying from Pierre SD to Billings years ago they would often cancel flights for "mechanical reasons" and make you stay another day so they could fill planes. I try to avoid UAL, but they have a monopoly on some flights. Delta and NorthWest Airlines have always been excellent if possible. UAL is the worst!

| 
Flew United from Omaha to New York. My flight was cancelled due to weather in New York. When I called the call center to book a new flight I was told the wait time was 30 minutes. It's now been 1 hour and 20 minutes and I'm still on hold. This is ridiculous. I have to travel with my wife and two small children and the flight automatically re-booked for us is not conducive for a young family. I'm incredibly disappointed.

|  Albany to San Francisco via Chicago. We found both legs of our flight on an A319 from Albany to Chicago and our 777-200 flight from Chicago to San Francisco to be outstanding. Check in and boarding was painless. Drinks were served within a minute of us taking our seats while the crew was friendly, professional and positive. Albany to Chicago was a quick flight with the seats great, inflight entertainment working well etc. The second leg on the 777-200 was everything and then some. Yes we had to sit to wait to be de-iced for almost 45 minutes, no problem,. Crew was equally as friendly on our second leg, flight 470 from Chicago to San Francisco. Every 10-15 minutes they were around to offer drinks, blankets or see if we needed anything. Some complain about the new Polaris seating, not sure why, we found them to have plenty of room, while lying flat or in any position. The breakfast was really great with a protein or spinach egg white option, both served with fresh fruit, soft biscuit and Greek yogurt. Really have to say United did a very nice job today! Only reason I didn’t give 5 stats for inflight entertainment was no live tv without paying, still plenty of movie options though. Luggage came out fast, all in all a great experience!
Route: Albany to San Francisco via Chicago

FullReview: |  Newark to San Francisco. I was flying back home from college and had packed so much that I couldn't fit my laptop back in my bag and left it on the plane. The night I got back, I woke up at 3am in a panic, realizing what I had done and filled out their lost baggage online form. To my surprise, I got a text back from United no less than 5 minutes later (at 3am – great service!) that said they had found it and gave me the option to pick it up or have it shipped to me. I chose to pick it up that morning from SFO and the woman working at the service desk in United's baggage claim terminal was extremely helpful – I had my laptop back in about 2 minutes! After doing what I never thought I would – leaving my laptop on the plane United provided me with excellent service on Christmas Eve and returned it back to me. Thank you United and thanks to their lost and found department!

|  Denver to Helena. Awful, 4 cracked flights 18 hours of layovers - no compensation, hotel or refund. Sleeping on the floor on Christmas Eve in Denver with 77 other passengers! Worst airline ever! We were in the sky and pilot turning around due to no one receiving in the tower. Once re landed in origin we were told it was “weather”, no compensation would be given - “sorry” next flight tomorrow at 1:45!

|  Austin to Baton Rouge via Houston. Outbound to Baton Rouge from Austin They tried to rip me off on baggage. I was told by reservations the laptop would not be a 3rd item. When I arrived to board the plane I was told I could not board with 3 bags. The laptop was a 3rd bag. Really? They finally allowed me to board. Inbound to Austin via Houston I thought I would need to check 3 bags. $25 for first, $35 for 2nd and $150 for third. Seriously? I was able to combine. Thank Goodness. Flight from Baton Rouge was delayed. The airline did not notify my connecting United flight so they could wait. Houston is a large airport. No courtesy. I will never fly United again.
Route: Austin to Baton Rouge via Houston

FullReview: |  Houston to Pittsburgh. Frequent significant delays. We have been delayed several times with United- once for seven hours due to no plane, then no crew, then other issues- we had about 10 updates to our departure time, so terrible estimates. Major issues like not having a plane? Isn’t this an airline company? Isn’t that your entire business? A two hour delay seems pretty standard. Yes the flights are cheaper, but if you need or want to depart on time don’t bother with United. Also, twice now the departure time has changed after booking before check in. We are seriously considering another airline since we’re tired of spending hours at the airport.

|  Laramie to Denver. They overbooked the flight, took half an hour to de-ice the aircraft and I has to run across the airport to find my gate in time. I was late and now I'm standing in a mile long customer service line. Thanks for ruining my holiday break United.

|  San Diego to San Francisco. Terribly rude ticketing agent, lady didn’t want to look up a flight herself, sent me to a kiosk to do what she was able to do without sending me to a kiosk. Her tone of voice was rude and not helpful. Ticket changing services for emergency situations are not permitted unless you pay an upgrade fee of $25 and then $200 flight ticket change and also the difference in ticket rate. I understand the policy, but emergency situations happen that we cannot foresee and have no reasonable way to change flight unless you pay ridiculous rates.

|  Kalispell to Denver. Rudest employees! None of them were friendly or helpful whatsoever. I’m pretty understanding of travel especially around the holidays but telling me that she can’t answer my question right now because she’s “too busy” is ridiculous. All I needed to know if the flight had been delayed any longer. I refuse to fly United Airlines again.

|  Brussels to Los Angeles via Newark / Chicago. Flight departed late at Brussels airport due to deicing truck which arrived late. Service onboard was very good and aircraft was clean. I lost connecting flight to LAX and they gave a boarding pass for the next available flight. Returning flight was on Boeing 757-300 from LAX to Chicago, good service and nice crew.. Flight arrived on time and we had enough time to change plane to Brussels. That flight departed on time and the service again was very good. I would fly them again!
Route: Brussels to Los Angeles via Newark / Chicago

FullReview: |  Cleveland to Phoenix via Houston. Not only did we almost not make it on the flight due to overbooking, but we missed our connection due to late arrival. We were lied to over three times when we landed in Houston. The flight attendant told us we would make our connection so we ran there to find out the gate was closed before we even got off our first flight. Each person we talked to was very rude and blamed everything on the weather, holidays or us the consumer. I have never had a worst experience with customer service. This whole thing is horrible. The lady that gave us our flights for the next day gave us a discount for a hotel. Needless to say I didn’t put a hotel stay in Houston in my budget. I will never fly United ever again and the only way they can make up for giving me the worst start to my vacation is a full refund. I didn’t pay to have to starve in an airport for 6hrs while I wait to fly to Denver and then finally to my destination.

|  Cannot thank the employees at United Airlines Savannah enough this morning. Made it 30 min before my flight and was told if I wanted to get on I could, but couldn't check my bags. Prepared to carry 3 bags, my purse and a 3 year old through 3 airports today to make it to Las Vegas. I get to the boarding where they were not only nice enough to let me board but the same wonderful people who checked me in were at the gate and checked my bags in for me!

|  Vienna to Newark via Zurich with United (Vienna to Zurich on Austrian, Zurich to Newark on United). We checked in two days before the flight and reserved seats, my one was 24K, so we do not sit split across the whole plane. When we arrived at the gate in Zurich, they gave us new Boarding cards with other seats across the whole plane. As we flew with our children, my wife and me would like to sit next to them. But United couldn't change the seats, so we had to accept it. Finally in the plane, most of the flight attendants were very rude, there was just one friendly FA on board. The food tasted horrible. It was the worst I've ever eaten in my whole life. Also the wifi didn't work. During the flight, the FA's were gone, we couldn't order something to drink and all the rubbish had to go into the seat pocket. Just before landing they handed out something like a Leach-Pizza piece. That also didn't taste good and it was full of fat. We aren't going to fly on this airline again.
ReviewTitle: "aren't going to fly this airline again"

FullReview: | Flew Orlando, FL to Philadelphia, PA. 10 and a half hours sitting in airports! Our first flight was delayed an hour and a half due to United’s fault, causing us to miss our connection. The next flight United could offer us was 9 hours later because they over booked all other flights. This is unacceptable! Basically, if you miss your flight due to United’s fault, you will be stuck sitting in the airport for many hours with a paltry $10 food voucher. Never flying United again.

|  Newark to Savannah. Extremely disappointed in my recent experience with United. I was flying back home from EWR with my carry-on dog. I had all the necessary paperwork, carrier, and I had purchased the dog a ticket as instructed (note: this was my first time flying with my dog on a United flight, I usually fly JetBlue with her). When I go to board the woman scanning my ticket said she was changing my seat for me. I said "thank you" thinking that would be a nice gesture, but I was wrong. Once on board she came on the plane and told me that I was not allowed to sit in that seat (the one she changed me to) with a pet because it had no seat in front of it to stow the animal. I asked if I could move back to my original seat and she told me no. The flight attendants, as well as other people on the plane tried to talk her into letting me change my seat and she still refused, called a manager, and proceeded to kick me off of my flight. It was the most HORRIFIC experience in my entire life. She booked me on a later flight and forgot to transfer my dog over to that ticket, so when I boarded the later flight they were giving me a difficult time having the dog. This I do understand because they didn't have a record of it. However, once we got it all sorted out and everything was fine, they attendants refused to give me any water or take my trash. It was like I never existed on the flight! I am blown away by how inconsiderate and rude United was to me. From the ticket lady to the flight attendants on my later flight. It seems that across the board they value unprofessional behavior. I am originally from NJ so I do understand the somewhat lack of compassion inside the actual airport, but that isn't something that should transfer over to the airline or flight.

|  Jackson to Aspen via Houston. I will never book a flight with United again. First I called not once but three times to verify I could carry my wedding dress on and specifically how it would be packed and the measurements of the bag which did fall into their accepted guidelines. I checked in at Jackson, MS and could not carry my dress on, or they’d charge me $50. So I had to check the bag, which I was NEVER told about a baggage charge, two of us flying, 4 bags checked - $120.00!!! Then, I understood the small aircraft to Houston, but to Aspen? Seriously? I will say the staff on the second flight was very nice but the pretzels served, all 5 of them (yes sarcasm), the pretzels were smaller than my fingernail but what really made me disgusted was when they were picking up the trash, we noticed they stacked the plastic drinking cups, trust me they were cocktail size cups, later they came by offering water & I realized they simply rinsed the cups!
ReviewTitle: "never book a flight with United again"

FullReview: |  Newark to San Jose. This is the second time I have a problem with United Airlines in the past couple of months. I purchased 3 last minute one way tickets to Costa Rica directly through the airline. When I checked out there was no notifications of having to purchase an onward ticket. When I got to airport I missed my flight because I was told I needed a round trip ticket to board and the only one they had available was over $800 I’d have to purchase 3 of them right away and I couldn’t afford it. When I let the United Airlines representative know I was a Costa Rican citizen she asked if my 12 year old and 2 year old “where Costa Rican citizens as well” when I told her no she continued to ask if “they had same father, because I’d need consent from them to leave the country” I thought that question was extremely rude and felt she asked me that only because of my ethnicity due to the fact she asked if I spoke English right from the start without me even speaking! Honestly made me cry from feeling so humiliated. United Airlines should worn people when buying one way tickets and most importantly should train staff to be more courteous specially in such vulnerable situations.

|  Taipei to Las Vegas via San Francisco. Above-average experience on this airline. I originally selected this flight based on price, and was pleasantly surprised. All aircraft clean (including bathrooms) and flights on time. Good selection of entertainment. The only drawbacks were the crew was a bit hurried during the meal service on the international flights. Additionally, two different (senior) flight attendants were not sure what they were serving - one told me she didn't know what kind of noodles she was serving; another told my seatmate she had no idea what was in the omelette and handed her the ingredient list on the foil cover to read. Crew still managed to keep us fed and hydrated during the flight.
Route: Taipei to Las Vegas via San Francisco

FullReview: | Portland to Santa Rosa via San Francisco. This is by far the worst airline I have ever flown. I will not use United Airlines ever again! I did not receive notice that my flights were being delayed. Santa Rosa was fogged in, told me I could take a shuttle or drive myself to San Francisco to make my connecting flight, but would not comp the shuttle ride, even though the other airlines were and no compensation for the fact that I was only using half of the flight I paid for. On my way back to Santa Rosa from Portland they delayed my flight by 3 hours, once again with no notice sent to me, and then made my lay over in San Fran 4.5 hours. When I asked for my luggage to take another shuttle since I only live an hour and a half away, they told me I would have to wait 2 hours to get it. They said I could pick it up in Santa Rosa since it would fly with or without me on the plane. I agreed and took the shuttle to Santa Rosa. When I got to the Santa Rosa airport, I went to United and asked about picking up my bag, they said that I could not pick it up after 6pm because they were closed but could deliver my bag to me instead, they took my address name and phone number as well as my bag number. I watched them (I could see and read the screen) pull up my bag info in their system and attach it to an email with all my information and directions on delivering my bag next day to my address between 6-8pm. 6-8pm comes and call the airline, get the run around about them saying that the person I spoke to never submitted a claim, and they have no record of the email that I watched him send being sent. Had to repeatly insist on speaking to a supervisor before being put through only to end up still without any idea of when or if I'll get my luggage back. In the end, I'm out 1 day of my vacation, $64.00 on shuttles that should have been connecting flights already paid for and my luggage.
Route: Portland to Santa Rosa via San Francisco

FullReview: | Atlanta to Newark. I just wanted to take the time to compliment United Airlines for the very excellent service my family and I received while we traveled to New Jersey for the Thanksgiving Holiday weekend. We flew out of Jackson/Hartsfield Atlanta airport very early in the morning on November 21 into Newark airport in New Jersey and flew home to Atlanta on November 25. Although we were prepared for and anticipated heavy traffic during those times, we were pleasantly surprised that everything went smoothly and we arrived at our destination a little earlier than expected. Both flights were smooth with just a little turbulence. The staff on both flights were friendly and on our return flight home we even received complimentary drinks and snacks which was a nice returning home luxury. We travel often due to having family on the west and east coasts and I will definitely look into picking United on future travel dates.

| Houston to San Diego. Terrible experience. Bait and switch when it comes to carry on luggage. Rude customer service on both ground and in flight. Tray tables and bathrooms were dirty. I will never fly United again. Very unfriendly skies. We flew with Spirit a few days before and they were much better.

| I have never written a review about anything, however I have had a ridiculous amount of horrible experiences with United that have outraged me so much that now for the rest of my flying career I will avoid flying with them at all costs. I have never had issues with any other airline, it is clear that United has many problems and does not know how to deal with any of them. I have been on a flight that they overbooked by 40 people coming back from Switzerland. I have flown with them to Shanghai in the summer of 2017 and the flight was not only delayed by 13 hours but they also kept us on the plane for 8 of those hours without providing us any reasoning or even doing the simple act of giving us water. And today, my flight to Chicago was delayed so I missed my connecting flight to Hartford which I had to rebook and now that second flight is also delayed. Get your act together United, you seem to be the only airline that just can’t figure it out.

| Louisville to Phoenix via Chicago. This is ridiculous. Now you not only have to pay for food but you also are provided with no entertainment in a 4-hour flight, unless you pay for Direct TV. The worst part is you are forced to pay with credit card if you want to see old movies such as The Lion King or Office Space. How can they rip you off that badly? They force to travel like sardines, they have no empty seats so checking in and out of flights involves standing in long lines to make sure that when you get on board your carry-on luggage will have space. They keep asking us for our cooperation because of a full flight. What do they do to make sure we have an enjoyable flight? We have to pay for food if we want it, pay for entertainment and suffer through the entire flight with the extra tiny space that they have given us in, for example, a Boeing 737. We, us customers, deserve a little better than this. Now you pay for checked bags, what are they going to charge us next? It needs to stop.

|  Richmond to Chicago. Customer service is the worst, if you would like to prevent your bags from being destroyed, it's best to pack light and carry on the plane, or check in your bag at the airplane. I purchased a bran new bag before flying and United destroyed it. Im not someone that flies all the time, so I didn't know I needed to get this taken care of within 24 hours, flying for the first time in 10 years and flying to Chicago was scary and it was a business trip. So I decided to wait until I got back to Richmond as I figured my bag would just get destroyed more. Once in Richmond the lady in the baggage desk for United just wanted to argue with me that the quality of my bag wasnt good. Didn't even apologize that United destroyed my bag. And for that lack of empathy on her part, I will never fly United again.

|  Houston to Newark. Worst airline I’ve ever flown, and will be the last time for me to fly this airline. It’s absurd that someone cannot even pay for an upgrade, and be treated with disrespect from a rude United airline employee for requesting to do so.

|  Palm Springs to San Francisco. Bought economy ticket which only allowed personal item to bring on plane and small size carry on. Suitcase needs to be checked it with $25 charge. However it was clearly stated on United web that if you have United  explorer Credit card you can bring small suitcase Carry on to the plane free of charge. I was told during check in that ticket must be purchased with United explorer Credit card in order to bring carry on inside plane free of charge. I bought ticket with a different card I kept showing them United web but  they would not pay attention and charged me $25.

|  Tampa to San Jose via Houston. Check in at TPA was quick and efficient. Boarding was timely and disciplined. Once we were all.seated and the main door was closed, the captain came on the PA to announce that there was a mechanical issue that would take at least an hour to fix. We all disembarked and general panic set in amongst those of us who were connecting in Houston. The experienced flyers amongst us understood that a one hour mechanical delay is usually the precursor to a cancelled flight, a missed connection, and an overnight stay in Houston. The harried gate agents began to reschedule connecting passengers. They had made some progress with the long line of nervous customers when at exactly one hour later, the head agent came on the PA to announce that a hydraulic leak had been repaired and that we were ready to reboard and depart for IAH. On both flights, I had the window seat in the forward over-wing emergency exit with the middle seat unoccupied. This is the seat I always reserve because the leg room is awesome and the passenger in front of you can't recline into your space. On the IAH-SJO flight I had the whole row to myself, which in some aspects is better than getting upgraded to 1st class. Pretzels and beverages were distributed efficiently on both flights, and more elaborate snacks and meals were available for purchase. The attendants were pleasant and courteous, the flights were smooth, and we arrived in San Jose safe, sound, and early. Despite the delay departing from Tampa, this turned out to be a pleasant day of flying.
Route: Tampa to San Jose via Houston

FullReview: |  Bismarck to Pittsburgh. Flight there was bearable but my flight back got cancelled on me (it may have been my fault) but the airport staff was terrible. They were basically saying well suck for you it’s not my problem. I ended up having to drive because of the absurd prices. Then the sad thing is that we went over to Delta and they were the nicest people ever and tried to help me. Later my brother left the same day to Fargo and his flight got so delayed that he missed his next flight. I ended up having to pick him up on my way just so he could get back without having to buy a whole other ticket. Will gladly say I will not fly United in a long time again.
ReviewTitle: "not fly United in a long time again"

FullReview: |  San Francisco to Orange County. I wanted to give Antonio C..... at the SFO airport a big thank you for understanding my situation and accommodated my request for earlier flight. Great employee at this airport was very understandable and sweet. Agent at the kiosk was very rude and not helpful.

|  Newark to San Francisco. I arrived at SFO at midnight. While collecting my baggage, which I had checked in after paying a baggage check in fee, found out that my baggage was coming on another flight. I have meeting starting at 8 in the morning and all my stuff are in the bag. I am still waiting for the the next flight at the airport and writing this review. I am waiting for the flight where my baggage is suppose to be and collect it and before I go all the way to my hotel. Delivery starts at 7:30, I cannot wait that long as I need my stuff the first thing in the morning.

|  Poor safety skills from the crew. Bassinet not removed for landing, people with tray tables down, seats reclined and exit row persons had their screens still out. Would have been an absolute disaster in an emergency. My pen ran out while filling out the customs form, the flight attendant told me I should have brought a spare. Extremely rude. Seats were average as expected, we were in an exit row so legroom good. Food was average however snacks were provided frequently.

| Returning home from Chicago to Portland on United Airlines (UA1836) after a week of travel I found myself in the middle seat behind the exit row with very little leg room. It could have been a rough flight but our flight attendants, were amazing! It was obvious they had this positive effect on other travelers as well. Good job and thanks for the lift!

|  Chicago to Tokyo Narita. The food was absolutely disgusting the eggs and potatoes were the grossest thing I've ever eaten, then they gave us this so called snack, two buns with a thin slice of meat in it. The seats were so small, besides the nasty disgusting food and tight seats, the flight was on time and smooth. I travel this route four times a years and finally got a chance to complain

|  San Francisco to Tokyo Narita. SFO lounge closed at international terminal, food was terrible, bag was lost and delivered only a day later despite a direct flight. Terrible service. Every time I use United Airlines I instantly regret it. The ground staff wasn't helpful nor friendly in SFO

|  Las Vegas to San Francisco. I purchased a last minute flight home to Las Vegas to spend time with family. Because it was so last minute, I was looking for cheap tickets and United had the best deal. I booked a 5:50 AM flight back to San Francisco in order to land and get to work. Having flowing in and out of McCarran International Airport quite frequently on early morning flights, I knew that I should be able to move through things fairly quickly. I arrived at the airport at 5:05 AM. I went to a kiosk to print my boarding pass and was stopped. United Airlines employees told me that I was too late to get on my 5:50 AM flight, and that I would have to wait in the ticketing line to rebook my flight. I kept trying to explain to them that at I still had over forty-five minutes until my flight left and that I wasn't checking any baggage, but they wouldn't listen to me. Instead, they forced me to stand in a ticketing line for 20 minutes by which point it really was too late for me to make the flight. When I got to the counter the woman rebooking me acted as though I was checking my back. When I explained that I wasn't, she got what can only be described as an "oh no" look on her face. Then, she very apologetically explained to me that a mistake had been made, and that I should have been permitted to pass through and get on the flight. Apparently, despite having tried to explain the exact same thing multiple times to the other employees they chose to stop me anyway. I had missed the cut off for passengers trying to check luggage (45 mins) but not for people just trying to print their boarding pass and go straight through to the flight (30 mins). What made it even more frustrating was that I arrived in the terminal at the gate for my first flight before it had even taken off. At that point, I should have been offered some sort of compensation for the wasted time, but United didn't give me anything. I filed an official complaint on the website, but unfortunately I don't have any proof of what actually happened, and so I don't expect that it will be resolved in my favor. I definitely will not be flying them again if I can avoid it.

|  Grand Rapids to Newark. Worst customer service ever. I will not use United Airlines again.They have nothing good to offer besides a cheap flight.
